title: Pistol Whip
text: Shootout: Boot your dude in this posse to send a dude in the other posse home booted. Your dude gets –1 bullets (minimum 0).
flavor: “Sloane wanted me to send you this message personally.” —Alice Stowe

title: Pony Express
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Discard a card to draw a card.
flavor: Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night... but arrows are another story.

title: The Stakes Just Rose
text: Shootout: Move one of your dudes into your posse. That dude becomes a stud.
flavor: Come out, come out wherever you are!

title: Circle M Ranch
text: Controller Noon, Boot: If you have 3 or fewer cards in your play hand, draw a card.
flavor: “As you can see, Mr. Crowley, Morgan will do whatever it takes to reach the top, and we’re always willing to help a friend do the same.” —Lillian Morgan

title: One Good Turn…
text: Noon: Draw a card. Cheatin’ Resolution: Gain 3 ghost rock.
flavor: “I sure do owe ya one, Mr. Grothe... too bad ya don’t drink.” —Clementine Lepp

title: Carter's Bounties
text: Controller Shootout, Boot: Move your dude into your posse from any location.
flavor: “The price is good, but that’s a bounty even I wouldn’t pursue.”

title: Steven Wiles
flavor: “I found him there, like it’d just been any other night, and offered him a job on the spot. It was a shame he declined. Any man who can stand up to a Hangin’ Judge was born to be a Ranger.” —Katie Karl

title: Unprepared
text: Shootout: Choose a dude. Boot that dude and their attached cards. That dude gets –1 bullets and cannot use their abilities. Their attached cards lose all traits, abilities, and bullet bonuses.
flavor: “Tarnation, woman! Nothin’ worse than bein’ late for a killin’!”

title: B & B Attorneys
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise or lower the bounty on a wanted dude by one (if the bounty goes to zero, the dude is no longer wanted).
flavor: “The best defense is a pouch full of ghost rock.” —Makaio Kaleo, Esq.

title: It's Not What You Know...
text: Resolution: Lower a player's draw hand by 1 rank. Cheatin' Resolution: Lower a player's draw hand by 4 ranks.
flavor: "Play the man, not the cards." -Steele Archer

title: Yan Li's Tailoring
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise a dude's influence by 1.
flavor: "I don't understand why people so upset. Whateley can't do much. Mayors, like gangs, bosses, and dreams... they come and go. Whoever owns this town, one thing for certain: They're going to want a nice shirt." -Yan Li

title: Rumors
text: Noon: Choose a dude. That dude gets –1 influence while at any location except home.
flavor: "Well, I never!"

title: Mustang
text: Noon, Boot: Move this dude (without booting).
flavor: "If you're ever lost, trust a mustang. He knows the way back." -Jon Longstride

title: Teleportation Device
text: After this gadget is invented, attach it to a deed that you control. Repeat Controller Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Choose your dude at this location and pull. If the pull is a club, discard the dude. Otherwise, move your dude to another location (without booting).

title: Soul Blast
text: Shootout Hex X, Boot: Choose a dude in this shootout. X is that dude's grit. If successful, send the dude home booted. If successful by 6 or more, ace the dude instead. If unsuccessful, move this Huckster home booted.

title: Coachwhip!
text: Cheatin' Resolution: The cheatin' player must boot one of their dudes. If in a shootout, that dude gets aced instead. If you have a legal hand, you choose the dude to boot or ace.
flavor: "Beware of snakes in the grass." -Avie Cline

title: Blake Ranch
flavor: "I've been on drives since I was knee-high to a mustang. And lemme tell ya, ma'am, them cows ain't right." -Jarret Blake

title: Kidnappin'
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark a dude. Your posse must have more total bullets than the marked dude. Raise the bounty of each dude in your posse by 1. If successful, discard the mark.
flavor: "Let's go for a ride." -Sanford Taylor

title: Charlie's Place
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise or lower the bullets of a dude at this location by 2.
flavor: "There's nothing in this town or its people so twisted or secret, that it can't be endured... if you have a good drink and someone to share it with." -Max Baine

title: A Fight They'll Never Forget
text: Shootout: Each dude in your posse gets +1 bullets. After each time any dude is aced as a casualty, the shooter in the other posse permanently gets 1 control point. Ace this card.
flavor: R.I.P. -David Oville Montreal

title: Baird's Build and Loan
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Play a deed (as shoppin'), reducing its cost by 2 ghost rock.
flavor: "A sizeable contribution indeed! The Master will be pleased, Lane. No need to look so dour." -Mr. Baird

title: Jake Smiley
text: Jake has +2 influence during the Sundown phase.
flavor: "Ugh... he is by far the biggest waste of a rose ever. The only one of my clowns who has proven to be more useless after I claimed him!" —Ivor Hawley

title: Arnold Stewart
text: Noon: Boot a Gadget on Arnold to discard the top five cards of your deck. If one of those cards was an Out of Town deed, you may boot Arnold to place the deed into your hand.
flavor: "I've made it this far by doing the right thing....I'm gonna keep doing the right thing."

title: Clementine Lepp
text: While in a Saloon you own, Clementine gets +1 influence and cannot be called out.
flavor: "I eventually gave up on Clementine..." - Pancho Castillo

title: Scoop Hound
text: Shootout, Boot: Shootout plays cannot bring dudes into either posse or send dudes home booted (they remain in the posse without booting).

title: Dave "Slim" Gorman
text: React: After Dave casts a Shootout Hex you may discard the Hex to have all dudes in the shootout become draws for this round.
flavor: "He clawed his way up from nuthin'. And if he has his way, that's what we'll all become." -Clementine Lepp

title: Undertaker
text: This deed's controller gains 2 ghost rock each time an in-play dude is aced.
flavor: "Leave me alone and let me go to hell by my own route." - Calamity Jane

title: Paralysis Mark
text: Noon Hex X, Boot: X is the value of a dude at this location. Boot the dude.
flavor: "I told ya you'd regret tryin' to lay a finger on me." -Jonah Essex

title: Rico Rodegain
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, look at your opponent's hand. Place your non-Grifter dudes on top of your deck and return their cost to your stash. Search your deck for up to the same number of dudes to add to your starting gang, following the standard setup rules.

title: Ivor Hawley
text: If your outfit is , Ivor's cost is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 0) for each Abomination in play and in any Boot Hill. React: After Ivor enters play from your hand, play up to two Hexes or Abominations from your Boot Hill. Reduce those cards' cost by 3 each.
flavor: "Pestilence sends its regards"

title: Auto-Revolver
text: You may equip this Gadget as a Shootout play (pay all costs). While this Auto-Revolver is in a shootout and you are forming a draw hand, when you redraw after discarding at least one card, you may draw one extra card.

title: Darius Hellstromme
text: If you are the leader, your shooter has -2 bullets if they do not have a Gadget Weapon attached. React, Boot: After an opposing dude is discarded or aced during a shootout, boot a Gadget Weapon in your posse to give your dude with a Gadget Weapon a permanent control point. If the opposing dude was discarded, they are aced instead.

title: Ezekiah Grimme
text: When attaching a spell to a card, increase the spell's ghost rock cost by the number of copies of that spell in play. React, Boot: After your dude successfully casts a spell attached to them, if the pull was a spell, you may attach it to that dude, booted (paying all costs). Noon, Boot: Boot your skilled dude to reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. If you revealed a spell you have less than 2 copies of in play, you may attach it to that dude (paying all costs). Shuffle the remaining revealed cards into your deck.

title: Jasper Stone
text: Except at home, only your shooter contributes to your draw hand bonuses. React, Boot: After posses are formed, choose a dude in the opposing posse. Your shooter has +2 bullets while opposing that dude, and while your posse has a non-token dude. If that opposing dude is aced, give your declared shooter a permanent control point and permanent +1 bullets.

title: Raven
text: If you are the leader, your posse has a -2 stud pentalty if it has less bullets than the opposing posse. You have an extra control point during Sundown if you control equal or more in-town deeds that you do not own compared to each other player. Noon, Boot: Choose an in-town deed. Your shooter has +2 bullets during shootouts there. The next time you win a shootout there, or if you control it during Sundown and do not own it, give your dude there a permanent +1 bullets if they do not already have a permanent bullet bonus.

title: A Slight Modification
text: React: After an opponent declares the use of a Shootout or non-Cheatin’ Resolution ability, boot a Gadget on a dude in your posse. Waive all costs of the ability, and that ability has no effect.

title: Point Blank
text: Resolution: Boot your stud dude in this posse. Your opponent must ace a dude in their posse with lower bullets than your dude's bullets.

title: Henry Moran
text: If Henry is unbooted when you would reveal an illegal draw hand during lowball, boot Henry, discard the illegal hand, and reveal the top five cards of your deck as your hand instead.

title: Inner Struggle
text: While this card is booted, reduce your shootout hand rank by 1. If you reveal an illegal draw hand and the owner of this card has a legal hand, boot this card. Cheatin’ Resolution: Attach this card to the cheatin’ player’s home, booted. That player discards one random card from their play hand.
flavor: "You're still with me. That's good." -Sloane, to Mario Crane

title: Mugging
text: Noon Job: Mark an opposing dude. Boot up to two cards attached to the mark. If the job succeeds, send the mark home booted, and you may ace up to two booted cards attached to the mark.

title: Darius Hellstromme
text: If you are the leader, your shooter has -2 bullets if they do not have a Gadget Weapon attached. React, Boot: After an opposing dude is discarded or aced during a shootout, boot a Gadget Weapon in your posse to give your dude with a Gadget Weapon a permanent control point. If the opposing dude was discarded, they are aced instead.

title: Ezekiah Grimme
text: When attaching a spell to a card, increase the spell's ghost rock cost by the number of copies of that spell in play. React, Boot: After your dude successfully casts a spell attached to them, if the pull was a spell, you may attach it to that dude, booted (paying all costs). Noon, Boot: Boot your skilled dude to reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. If you revealed a spell you have less than 2 copies of in play, you may attach it to that dude (paying all costs). Shuffle the remaining revealed cards into your deck.

title: Jasper Stone
text: Except at home, only your shooter contributes to your draw hand bonuses. React, Boot: After posses are formed, choose a dude in the opposing posse. Your shooter has +2 bullets while opposing that dude, and while your posse has a non-token dude. If that opposing dude is aced, give your declared shooter a permanent control point and permanent +1 bullets.

title: Raven
text: If you are the leader, your posse has a -2 stud pentalty if it has less bullets than the opposing posse. You have an extra control point during Sundown if you control equal or more in-town deeds that you do not own compared to each other player. Noon, Boot: Choose an in-town deed. Your shooter has +2 bullets during shootouts there. The next time you win a shootout there, or if you control it during Sundown and do not own it, give your dude there a permanent +1 bullets if they do not already have a permanent bullet bonus.

title: Hellstromme Plant #9
text: Controller Noon/Shootout, Pay 1 Ghost Rock, Boot: Choose a dude you own and control. Unboot a Horse or Gadget attached to that dude. You can use one of the abilities on that Horse or Gadget another time this turn.
flavor:
"Brew Unto Others"
Yards Brewing, PAX Unplugged 2017

title: Sunday Best
text: This dude has +3 Influence during the Upkeep phase. React, Boot: At the start of the Upkeep Phase, move this dude to an adjacent location (without booting).
flavor: "Be merciful unto me, oh God, be merciful..."

title: Willa Mae MacGowan
text: Resolution: Ace Willa to send all other dudes in your posse home booted.
flavor: "The children here need protection from the terrors too, Lucy. And I'll always have their backs, come hell or high water."

title: General Store
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Attach a goods or spell (as shoppin'), reducing the cost of that card by 2 ghost rock.
flavor: "Mr. Earp, I will testify those are Frank Sitwell's boots, but you tie him to that stagecoach robbery, you're gonna have more trouble from them cowboys."

title: Shotgun
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose and ace an opposing dude in this shootout with a value less than or equal to this dude's bullets.
flavor: Sometimes natural selection does the job just as well as good marksmanship.

title: Joker
flavor: "Our ringmaster in Gomorra helped me when I had these problems, Curly Bill. This Stone fellow reminds me of him. If you truly seek Death, he's your answer."

title: Morgan Cattle Co.
text: Noon, Boot: Boot your dude to play a deed, reducing that deed's cost by that dude's influence, and move that dude to that deed.

title: Jael's Guile
text: Cheatin’ Resolution, Boot: If your hand is illegal, you must boot this dude to use this ability. Your opponent boots or discards a dude in their posse, then boots or discards a dude in their posse. Non-wanted dudes cannot be chosen if there are wanted dudes that can be chosen.

title: No Turning Back
text: Noon: Ace a dude you own and control to gain ghost rock equal to their cost. Resolution: Ace a dude you own and control to reduce your casualties this round to zero. Choose a dude who gets +2 bullets and becomes a stud for the remainder of the Shootout. Your dudes cannot flee this round.
flavor: "I knew it was a fight for life." - Wyatt Earp

title: The Ghostly Gun
text: Resolution: Put The Ghostly Gun into your draw hand; he becomes the suit and value of your choice. Discard a card from your draw hand.
flavor: "He is a man of few words, but his guns speak volumes." - Ivor Hawley

title: Hired Guns
text: Noon: Place a dude from your discard pile into your hand.
flavor: Their aim don't matter if there's enough of 'em.

title: Hired Help
text: Shootout: A 2-stud Gunslinger token enters play and joins your posse.
flavor: "Dunno where he came from, but if he can shoot, we can use him." - Lane Healey

title: Willa Mae MacGowan
text: Resolution: Ace Willa to send all other dudes in your posse home booted.
flavor: "The children here need protection from the terrors too, Lucy. And I'll always have their backs, come hell or high water."

title: Smiling Tom
text: Tom can only move to your home or to a location that has another Fourth Ring dude.
flavor: "Thomas has gone off wandering again!" - Kevin Wainwright

title: Nicodemus Whateley
text: While your dudes are at in-town deeds, they gain the ability: "Noon, Boot: If this dude has 1 or more influence, give Nicodemus a control point." At the end of Sundown, or if he is ever at home, Nicodemus loses all his control points.

title: Pat's Perch
flavor: "No one is sure who Pat is, but there seems to be activity out there." - Dave Montreal

title: Fetch
text: Cheatin' Resolution Hex 5, Boot: You may place a card from your draw hand into your play hand after resolution. If this is a shootout, you suffer 3 less casualties this round.
flavor: I've always wanted one of these!

title: ...It's who you know
text: Noon: One of your dudes calls out an opposing dude at their location. All dudes in both posses use their influence rather than their bullet rating for the shootout (but keep their bullet type). Your dude becomes a stud for this shootout.

title: Forced Quarantine
text: Discard this dude at the end of the turn. Noon Job, Boot: Mark an opposing dude whose current influence, bullets, or value are lower than their printed values. If successful, boot the mark, attach this card to them, and your leader gets one permanent control point.

title: The Fourth Ring
text: React, Boot: After your dude succeeds at a spell pull while not at home, you may discard a card from your hand to gain 1 ghost rock and draw a card.

title: Law Dogs
text: Noon, Boot: Choose a dude. Boot your dudes with a total influence greater than the chosen dude's influence to raise that dude's bounty by 1.

title: Morgan Cattle Co.
text: Noon, Boot: Boot your dude to play a deed, reducing that deed's cost by that dude's influence, and move that dude to that deed.

title: The Sloane Gang
text: Noon, Boot: Boot your dude in the town square. If that dude is still in the town square during the Sundown phase, either gain 1 ghost rock per other player, or your dude permanently gets 1 control point if they do not already have one.

title: Micah Ryse
text: Noon: Boot a Hex on Micah to move him (without booting).
flavor:
"Does he ever smile?"
"I don't think you'd want to see the kind of thing that makes him smile."

title: Mongwau the Mighty
text: Shootout: Discard a Hex from Mongwau to make him a stud.
flavor: "Step right up and see the mystic fortitude of my mighty magic… you damned ignorant buffoons."

title: Bobo
text: Bobo gains a bullet bonus equal to the highest Huckster skill rating in play.
flavor: I don't know where he came from, but that clown creeps me out.

title: Arnold McCadish
text: React, Pull, Boot: When a dude is discarded (not aced) as a casualty in a shootout, if the pull is higher than the dude's value, send that dude home booted instead.
flavor: "You know what they say… 37th time's the charm."

title: The Ghostly Gun
text: Resolution: Put The Ghostly Gun into your draw hand; he becomes the suit and value of your choice. Discard a card from your draw hand.
flavor: "He is a man of few words, but his guns speak volumes." - Ivor Hawley

title: Avie Cline
flavor: "Pancho's been at that circus three times this week.  Boy must really love clowns." - Fred Aims

title: Kevin Wainwright
text: Noon: Move Kevin (without booting) to the same location as a Huckster. Kevin becomes a stud.
flavor: "Little guy follows Mr. Hawley everywhere he goes.  It'd be adorable if it wasn't so darned creepy." - Lucy Clover

title: Tyxarglenak
text: Other players cannot choose or affect your Hucksters at this location with action cards if they could legally choose to affect Tyxarglenak instead.
flavor: "Come on now Tyx.  There's work to be done." - Ivor Hawley

title: Jia Mein
text: Shootout: Attach a Hex to Jia Mein (paying all costs) to make him a stud.
flavor: "You must be strong enough to control the powers you call forth.  Let the mask on your scarred face be a constant reminder of your weakness." - Ivor Hawley

title: Ivor Hawley
text: While he has a Hex, Ivor gets +1 bullets, +1 influence, and +1 Huckster skill.
flavor: "Here in the fourth ring you will see wonders that will change you forever!  Come one, come all, to our travelin circus!"

title: Lucinda "Lucy" Clover
text: If your opponent in Lucy's shootout reveals a cheatin' hand, raise the bounty on each dude in their posse by 1 (including from 0 to 1).
flavor: "The storm took everything from that girl.  Not much scares her anymore." - Abram Grothe

title: Judge Harry Somerset
text: Noon Job, Boot: Harry leads a job that marks a wanted dude. If successful, ace the mark.

title: Philip Swinford
text: Each time a player reveals a cheatin' hand and your hand is legal, you may discard a card from your play hand to draw a card.
flavor: "This town'll take the shine offa him soon enough." - Dave Montreal

title: Tommy Harden
text:
If your opponent in Tommy's shootout reveals a cheatin' hand, raise your draw hand rank by 1 for this round.
If your draw hand is also legal, raise your hand rank by 2 instead.
flavor: "Sweetrock had plenty of guys like Tommy on the payroll.  Some of them actually worked for the company, too." - Max Baine

title: Prescott Utter
text: Prescott's bullets and influence are equal to the number of Law Dogs at his location (including himself).
flavor: "It seems that everyone has a vice in this town.  At least Mr. Utter's doesn't keep him from doing what's right." - Abram Grothe

title: Andreas Andregg
flavor: "Claims he was a beekeeper back East, but I've never heard of a beekeeper who could handle a gatling pistol like that." - Abram Grothe

title: Xiong "Wendy" Cheng
text: Shootout, Boot: Send an opposing dude home booted.
flavor: "Poor girl's lost every happiness imaginable.  All that's left for her is to make sure no one suffers the same fate." - Abram Grothe

title: Clyde Owens
text: Noon: Clyde calls out a dude at his location. A wanted dude cannot refuse the call out.
flavor: "It's s shame Clyde can't control his drinking.  He'd have my job if he could just keep sober." - Dave Montreal

title: Abram Grothe
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark a Holy Ground deed. If successful, discard all Abominations and wanted dudes at that deed.
flavor: "Why a sword?  Easy... swords never run out of bullets."

title: Sheriff Dave Montreal
text: If your opponent in Dave's shootout reveals a cheatin' hand and you do not, your dudes cannot be casualties this round.
flavor: "It's taking all he has to hold this town together. Let's see what happens when we start pulling on threads." - Jonah Essex

title: Irving Patterson
text: When Irving joins a posse, gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Them beeves sell big no matter where you go.  Makes ya wonder what they put in the feed." - Tommy Harden

title: Prof. Eustace True
text: Noon: Discard a Gadget from Eustace to move him to another location (without booting).
flavor: "If Mrs. Morgan wants this done on time, tell her I need to be left alone to do my work!"

title: Elander Boldman
text: Shootout, Pull: Choose your dude with a Weapon Gadget in this shootout. If the pull is a club, discard that dude. Otherwise, that Gadget gets +3 bullets.

title: James Ghetty
text: When James enters a posse, place 4 ghost rock on him. The ghost rock may be used to pay for Shootout abilities (it is not a bounty). Discard his unused ghost rock after the shootout.
flavor: "He always seems to have a trick up his sleeve." - Max Baine

title: Jon Longstride
text: Noon: Unboot Jon's Horse. You may use the Horse's ability an additional time.
flavor: "Mrs. Morgan hired me to take care of the horses, Mr. Baine.  I need you to approve my request for a new stable."

title: Lane Healey
text: Lane gets +2 bullets while he has a Horse.
flavor: "Max, I understand the need for security, but if Healey keeps interfering with the law, he's gonna end up on the wrong side of it." - Dave Montreal

title: Jarrett Blake
text: Shootout: If Jarrett has a Horse, swap him with one of your dudes in the posse (Jarrett joins the posse. The other dude moves to Jarrett's location and is no longer in the posse).
flavor: "No matter how far we progress, men like Jarrett will always be the heart and soul of this company." - Max Baine

title: Harold Aimslee
text: Noon, Boot: Discard a card from your hand to get a non-Weapon Gadget from your discard pile. Show the card and add it to your hand.

title: Rémy LaPointe
text: Shootout, Pay 1–4 Ghost Rock: Rémy gets +1 bullets for each ghost rock spent, to a maximum rating of 5 bullets.
flavor: "Mon pistolet parle la langue universelle."

title: Max Baine
text:
Max is worth 1 control point while you control 2 or more Ranches.
Your other dudes at Ranches get +1 influence and +3 value.
flavor: "Nathaniel Morgan's legacy is brimming with potential.  And it's the greatest hope this town has of a future."

title: Allie Hensman
text: Noon, Boot: If Allie is at the town square, she permanently gets 1 control point.
flavor: "Stay in the town, blend in.  You're worth more as a pair of eyes than a gun." - Jonah Essex

title: Fred Aims
text: Fred's influence is equal to his bounty.
flavor: "I don't rob banks because I need the money.  I do it cause it ticks off those rich, uppity types.  The money's just a nice bonus."

title: Lawrence Blackwood
text: Noon, Boot: If Lawrence is at a deed you do not own, he is worth 1 control point while he stays at that deed.
flavor: "An ex-Confederate scout.  Only match for his skill at getting out of trouble is his skill at getting into it." - Jonah Essex

title: Marion Seville
text: Marion gets +2 bullets while he is wanted.
flavor: "Last man to point out that 'Marion' sounds like a girl's name had to go find himself a girl's name." - Pancho Castillo

title: Sanford Taylor
text: Noon, Boot: Call out a dude at this deed. If Sanford is wanted, the call-out cannot be refused.
flavor: "Sanford has it out for lawmen.  Rumor has it he met Ghost Creek's former sheriff on the road, and gunned her down for fun." - Jonah Essex

title: Barton Everest
text: If you reveal a cheatin' hand in Barton's shootout, raise your draw hand rank by 1 for this round..
flavor: "The real crime is letting a fool keep his money."

title: Pancho Castillo
flavor: "I don't think the madame was too upset that I stole her jewels. Her heart?  That's a different story."

title: Jonah Essex
text: Other wanted dudes in Jonah's posse get +1 bullets.
flavor: "True power is not in a name or a bauble, but in your resolve.  Yes, we follow you because you are Sloane.  But you are Sloane because we follow you."

title: Silas Aims
text: Silas's bullets are equal to his bounty.
flavor: "My brother might not care about the enemies he makes.  That's because I do it for him."

title: Sloane
text:
Sloane's bounty cannot be reduced below 1.
Sloane and your other dudes at her location do not boot when forming or joining a posse.
flavor: "She wants this hellhole so badly, I've half a mind to give it to her." - Dave Montreal

title: Clementine Lepp
text: While in a Saloon you own, Clementine gets +1 influence and cannot be called out.
flavor: "I have yet to make headway with her, but, give me time." - Pancho Castillo

title: Olivia Jenks
flavor: That schoolmarm don't take no guff.  She's as good with a gun as she is with the kids.

title: Ramiro Mendoza
text:
Whenever Ramiro joins a posse, pay 1 ghost rock.
If you do not or cannot pay, discard him.
flavor: "Hired guns aren't anything new.  Never met one who charges by the bullet before." - Lane Healey

title: Steele Archer
flavor: "For the right price, I can get you the information you need."

title: Travis Moone
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, shuffle your play hand into your deck and draw 5 cards.
flavor: "Oops, I messed that trick up!  Lemme try again."

title: Androcles Brocklehurst
text: Noon, Boot: Choose another player's dude at a deed you own but don't control. Gain ghost rock equal to that dude's influence.
flavor: "You have a court date in front of Judge Somerset?  I'm afraid I will have to double my rate."

title: Steven Wiles
flavor: "Sometimes you need an extra set of guns.  I learned not to ask about his past.  Just pay him, thank him, and walk away.  But no man ends up like him without a story." - Dave Montreal

title: Dr. Dawn Edwards
text: If you discard Dawn as a casualty, you may search your deck for Eve Henry (if you don't already have her in play), and play her for free at this location. Shuffle your deck.

title: Clint Ramsey
flavor: "I do believe you are right, Kevin.  That is the same mane we saw in the North." - Ivor Hawley

title: Eve Henry
text: If you discard Eve as a casualty, you may search your deck for Dr. Dawn Edwards (if you don't already have her in play), and play her for free at this location. Shuffle your deck.

title: Bank of California
text: Players cannot take ghost rock from the Bank's controller.
flavor: Would you care to make a deposit?

title: Pony Express
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Discard a card to draw a card.
flavor: "It appears that Mrs. Morgan is on her way back, and that the claims were legitimate." - Max Baine

title: Gomorra Parish
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Ace a card from your hand to gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Reverend Inbody can stir the soul like no other." - Abram Grothe

title: The Town Hall
text: Controller React, Boot: At the start of the Upkeep phase, choose a dude at this location. Lower that dude's upkeep by their influence.
flavor: "Now all we need is a Mayor to run it." - Dave Montreal

title: 1st Baptist Church
text: Raise the controller's hand size by one.
flavor: "We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was builded these many years ago." - Ezra 5:11

title: Yan Li's Tailoring
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise a dude's influence by 1.

title: B & B Attorneys
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise or lower the bounty on a wanted dude by one (if the bounty goes to zero, the dude is no longer wanted).
flavor: Not sure who's more hated here… the criminals or those who defend 'em.

title: Dead Dog Tavern
text: Determine control of this deed using bullets instead of influence.
flavor: "Keep runnin' your mouth and the 'dog' won't be the only one dead." - Clyde Owens

title: Charlie's Place
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise or lower the bullets of a dude at this location by 2.
flavor: "Charlie Landers?  He's mostly retired.  He owns the saloon, but he spends most of his time on the road.  Says this town has too many bad memories."

title: Pearly's Palace
text: Controller React, Boot: After a shootout starts but before any player makes a Shootout play, make a Shootout play.

title: Killer Bunnies Casino
text: The controller of this deed may discard one additional card each Sundown phase.
flavor: "The drinks might be a bit watered down, but Clementine more than makes up for it with her beauty." - Pancho Castillo

title: Stagecoach Office
text: Controller React, Boot: When you bring a non-token dude into play, place that dude at any location you control.
flavor: Drivers Wanted

title: Blake Ranch
flavor: "My family has been raising horses since my great-grandfather.  And lemme tell ya Elander, that mechanical monster is no horse." - Jarrett Blake

title: Cattle Market
text:
This deed has 1 control point if another Ranch is in play.
All dudes have their value raised by 3 while at this deed.

title: Circle M Ranch
text: Controller Noon, Boot: If you have 3 or fewer cards in your play hand, draw a card.

title: Pat's Perch
flavor: "No one is sure who Pat is, but there seems to be activity out there." - Dave Montreal

title: Bunkhouse
text: Dudes with 0 or 1 influence, excluding any modifiers from this deed, have +1 influence while at this deed.

title: Morgan Research Institute
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise or lower the skill rating of a dude at this location by 2 (the skills are Huckster, Blessed, Shaman, and Mad Scientist).

title: Carter's Bounties
text: Controller Shootout, Boot: Move your dude into your posse from any location.
flavor: "Of course it is safe and profitable.  How do you think I was able to found this fine establishment?  Now go get 'em!" - Carter

title: The Union Casino
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Choose your dude at this location and pay any amount of ghost rock. Each other player may then pay any amount of ghost rock. If you paid at least 4 ghost rock more than any other player, your dude permanently gets 1 control point.

title: Jackson's Strike
flavor: "You leave him alone, he'll leave you alone.  Let's not learn that lesson again." - Max Baine

title: Undertaker
text: This deed's controller gains 2 ghost rock each time an in-play dude is aced.
flavor: The real money isn't in mining or cattle.  It's in death.

title: General Store
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Attach a goods or spell (as shoppin'), reducing the cost of that card by 2 ghost rock.

title: The Pharmacy
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Unboot a dude.
flavor: "Their elixir has kept me from illness, so far." - Pancho Castillo

title: Railroad Station
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Move your dude from this location to another location (without booting).
flavor: "I'm here to pick up the shipment… and to guarantee your silence." - Ivor Hawley

title: Telegraph Office
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Choose a dude that was brought into play this Noon phase. Gain ghost rock equal to the dude's influence.

title: Pair of Six-Shooters
text: Cheatin' Resolution, Boot: One card in your draw hand changes to the suit and value of your choice.
flavor: "One works. Two work better." - Fred Aims

title: Bluetick
text: Noon, Boot: Move this dude to the same location as a wanted dude.
flavor: "One of those fellers gets your scent, you ain't gettin' away lest you shoot it.  Of course you do that, you may as well get your own rope." - Silas Aims

title: Peacemaker
text: This dude cannot be changed to a draw, and cannot have their bullets lowered by another player's Shootout ability.
flavor: "I wish I could say it brings me peace, or that it brings it to those I am forced to ise it on.  The one thing it brings, is justice." - Abram Grothe

title: Shotgun
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose and ace an opposing dude in this shootout with a value less than or equal to this dude's bullets.

title: Whiskey Flask
text: Noon, Boot: Boot this dude and discard a card from your hand to draw a card.
flavor: "Just a little nip will keep you going all day." - Pancho Castillo

title: Mustang
text: Noon, Boot: Move this dude (without booting).
flavor: "Mustangs like to roam.  I do my best to raise them that way." - Jarrett Blake

title: Pearl-Handled Revolver
text: This dude is a stud.
flavor: "I took this from a deputy I killed down south.  The trigger is so smooth you barely even have to squeeze." - Sanford Taylor

title: Roan
text: React, Boot: Prevent this dude from booting when they join a posse (this does not allow a booted dude to join a posse).
flavor: "Let the horse guide you.  He knows the way better'n you do." - Jon Longstride

title: Auto-Revolver
text: You may equip this Gadget as a Shootout play (pay all costs). While this Auto-Revolver is in a shootout and you are forming a draw hand, when you redraw after discarding at least one card, you may draw one extra card.

title: Pinto
text: Shootout, Boot: Move this dude into a posse (without booting; this can move a booted dude).

title: Flame-Thrower
text: This dude is a stud. Shootout, Pay 1–3 Ghost Rock, Boot: Raise the bullets on this Gadget by 1 for each ghost rock spent. Each round's loser takes 1 extra casualty.

title: Force Field
text: Repeat Resolution, Pay X Ghost Rock: Raise your draw hand rank by X for this round, but not to exceed your opponent's hand rank.
flavor: "Mr. Aimslee, so you think you can make them bigger?  Big enough to protect a coach, or even a herd?" - Max Baine

title: Quickdraw Handgun
text: Cheatin' Resolution, Boot: If you have a legal draw hand, exchange draw hands with the cheatin' player. Cheatin' cards cannot be played on you for this round of the shootout.
flavor: "Olivia carries hers everywhere, Dave.  Gomorra is dangerous." - Wylie Jenks

title: Mechanical Horse
text: Repeat Noon, Pay 2 Ghost Rock: Move this dude. React, Boot: Prevent this dude from booting when they join a posse (this does not let a booted dude join a posse).

title: Tin Star
text: Wanted dudes cannot refuse a call-out from this dude.
flavor: "I follow the path of truth and honor.  If I ever stray, this badge and God's word will lead me back." - Abram Grothe

title: Doyle's Hoyle
text: React, Boot: After this dude makes a pull, discard the pull to replace it with this card. Resolution, Boot: Discard a card from your draw hand to replace it with this card. If the discarded card was a 2, raise your hand rank by one.

title: Buffalo Rifle
text: If this dude is adjacent to the location of a shootout or a job's mark, they can join a posse, without moving or booting, even if booted.

title: Legendary Holster
text: Shootout Pull, Boot: If the pull is lower than this dude's bullets, ace one dude in the opposing posse.
flavor: "Remember the holster is a tool to make you stronger.  But your strength within must be far greater." - Jonah Essex

title: Auto Cattle-Feeder
text: After this is invented, attach it to a Ranch that you control. Controller Noon, Boot: Gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Who cares if it's safe?  It works and it makes us money." - Eustace True

title: Soul Blast
text: Shootout Hex X, Boot: Choose a dude in this shootout. X is that dude's grit. If successful, send the dude home booted. If successful by 6 or more, ace the dude instead. If unsuccessful, move this Huckster home booted.

title: Ace in the Hole
text: React Hex 6, Boot: When you reveal your draw hand in a shootout, boot this Huckster. Ace a card in your draw hand. Replace it with a card from your play hand.
flavor: "Things are not always what they seem, friend." - Steele Archer

title: Shadow Walk
text: Noon Hex 7, Boot: Move this Huckster to any location. Shootout Hex 7, Boot: Move this Huckster to join your posse. You may make another Shootout play.

title: Blood Curse
text: Noon Hex 9, Boot: A dude at this or an adjacent location gets –1 influence and –1 bullets. Shootout Hex 9, Boot: One opposing dude gets –2 bullets.
flavor: Feelin' queasy there, pardner?

title: Raising Hell
text: Shootout Hex 8, Boot: Ace a card from your play hand. One Abomination from your Boot Hill enters play (pay all costs) and joins this Huckster's posse. Ace this card.

title: Establishin' Who's in Charge
text: Noon Job: Mark an in-town deed. If successful, the deed permanently gains 1 control point.
flavor: "You're right, a little piece of paper from the bank isn't what makes this land mine.  It's that little piece of paper and my friends with the guns." - Lane Healey

title: Hired Guns
text: Noon: Place a dude from your discard pile into your hand.
flavor: Their aim don't matter if there's enough of 'em.

title: Lady Luck
text: Noon: You can discard as many of your cards as you like during Sundown.
flavor: "It seems that Lady Luck was smiling upon me.  Turns out that she was just leading me on before shooting me in the back." - Steele Archer

title: Bottom Dealin'
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Discard the cheatin' player's draw hand and replace it with the top five cards of your deck (those cards still go to your discard pile).

title: Make the Smart Choice
text: Shootout: Reduce a dude's bullets by their influence. The dude's controller may move them home booted (even if already booted).
flavor: "The best way to win a fight is to avoid the fight altogether." - Dave Montreal

title: Tresspassin'
text: Noon: Choose a Private deed you own. Other players' dudes there must move home booted, or gain 1 bounty each.
flavor: "Fred, next time we need to hole up someplace, we should probably make sure whoever's there ain't worse than the law." - Silas Aims

title: Auction
text: Noon: Choose a deed in play. It becomes Private. If you own and control that deed, gain 1 ghost rock for each dude controlled by another player at that deed.

title: The Stakes Just Rose
text: Shootout: Move one of your dudes into your posse. That dude becomes a stud.
flavor: "You didn't expect the sheriff to come alone, did you?" - Lucy Clover

title: Sun in Yer Eyes
text: Shootout: Choose a dude in this shootout. That dude gets –2 bullets (minimum 0) and becomes a draw.
flavor: Duel at high noon? Make it six a.m. I do my killing before breakfast.

title: Ambush
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark a dude. If the mark is not wanted, raise the bounty on each dude in your posse by 1. If successful, ace the mark.
flavor: "Going somewhere, Hoss?  The boss wants to talk to you." - Fred Aims

title: Coachwhip!
text: Cheatin' Resolution: The cheatin' player must boot one of their dudes. If in a shootout, that dude gets aced instead. If you have a legal hand, you choose the dude to boot or ace.

title: War Paint
text: Noon: One of your dudes gets +2 bullets.
flavor: "They do it to intimidate their enemies.  Since you are taking the herd the long way around to avoid them, it obviously worked." - Jon Longstride

title: Bad Company
text: Noon: Choose a wanted dude. That dude gets +3 bullets and is a stud. If any player collects bounty on that dude this turn, they gain 4 extra ghost rock.
flavor: "They'd never have put such a bounty on my head if they thought anybody'd live to claim it." - Jonah Essex

title: Hiding in the Shadows
text: Noon: Choose one of your dudes. Other players cannot choose or affect that dude with Shootout abilities.

title: Pistol Whip
text: Shootout: Boot your dude in this posse to send a dude in the other posse home booted. Your dude gets –1 bullets (minimum 0).
flavor: "Why waste the bullet?" - Wendy Cheng

title: Concealed Weapons
text: Noon: Your dudes may attach goods and spells (as Shoppin') at any location, and as Shootout plays.
flavor: "What else have you got under that dress?" - Pancho Castillo

title: Hot Lead Flyin'
text: React: After you take casualties for losing a round of a shootout, pull. For each dude you discarded or aced as a casualty this round with a value higher than the pull, the winner takes 1 casualty.
flavor: "The more people you have shooting, the more chance of someone getting hit." - Steven Wiles

title: One Good Turn…
text: Noon: Draw a card. Cheatin' Resolution: Gain 3 ghost rock.

title: Kidnappin'
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark a dude. Your posse must have more total bullets than the marked dude. Raise the bounty of each dude in your posse by 1. If successful, discard the mark.
flavor: "Welcome to the circus!" - Bobo

title: Pinned Down
text: Shootout: Choose a dude. They must be selected as the first casualty. If that dude is chosen as the shooter, they get –3 bullets (minimum 0).
flavor: Pokin' out your head is liable to get it blown clean off.

title: Run 'Em Down!
text: Noon: Choose any number of your dudes, each with a Horse, at one location. Move them to an adjacent location that has an opposing dude without a Horse. Boot that dude. You may call that dude out.
flavor: "You can run, but - actually, scratch that.  You can't run." - Lane Healey

title: Bounty Hunter
text: Noon: A 2-stud Gunslinger token enters play at a wanted dude's location. The Gunslinger calls out that dude, who cannot refuse. Remove the Gunslinger token from the game after the shootout.

title: Reserves
text: Noon: Gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Even in these forsaken parts, I find it pays to sock something away for a rainy day." - Max Baine

title: Rumors
text: Noon: Choose a dude. That dude gets –1 influence while at any location except home.
flavor: "A crazed gunman, a wild dog, a shabling horror - those I can handle.  Venomous words like these, I stay away from." - Abram Grothe

title: Cheatin' Varmint
text: Resolution: Pay 5 ghost rock to lower a player's draw hand by 2 ranks. Cheatin' Resolution: Lower a player's draw hand by 2 ranks.

title: Fresh Horses
text: Noon: Unboot all your Horses at one location. Any abilities on the Horses that have been used can be used an extra time.
flavor: "I don't know what they're feeding those horses at the Morgan ranches, but it's given them the persistence of Death himself, plus the glossiest coats I've ever seen." - Pancho Castillo

title: Magical Distraction
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Discard a spell from your dude in this posse and pull. Your draw hand rank equals the value of your pull (to a maximum rank of 11).

title: Extortion
text: Noon: Choose a deed that you control but do not own. Gain ghost rock equal to its production.
flavor: "Give a dimwit a gun and he thinks he's king of the whole danged world." - Philip Swinford

title: Recruitment Drive
text: Noon Job: Mark the town square (any player may oppose the job). If successful, put a dude or deed into play from your discard pile, reducing its cost by 5 ghost rock.
flavor: I always have work for hardy folk who don't ask a lot of questions." - Ivor Hawley

title: Unprepared
text: Shootout: Choose a dude. Boot that dude and their attached cards. That dude gets –1 bullets and cannot use their abilities. Their attached cards lose all traits, abilities, and bullet bonuses.
flavor: I told you.  I do my killing before breakfast.

title: A Coach Comes to Town
text: Noon Job: Mark the town square. If successful, gain 4 ghost rock. If not, each player with a dude in the opposing posse gains 4 ghost rock.
flavor: "Mr. Baine, Lane Healey is doing an excellent job defending our shipments.  I just wish we didn't need the likes of him." - James Ghetty

title: Hex Slingin'
text: Resolution: Discard a Hex from your dude in this posse to raise your draw hand rank by 2.
flavor: "Power comes not in might, but in knowing how to overcome might." - Jia Mien

title: This is a Holdup!
text: Noon: Boot your dude at a deed you don't own to take ghost rock from the owner up to the production of that deed. Raise the bounty on your dude by the amount of ghost rock taken.

title: Clear Out!
text: Noon: Move your dude to a deed that you own but do not control.
flavor: "I'm getting sick of these freaks!  Can't a man get a moment of pieace around here?" - Tommy Harden

title: Missed!
text: Shootout: Unboot one of your dudes in this posse.
flavor: "It ain't often you get a second chance like this.  Try not to waste it." - Jonah Essex

title: Takin' Ya With Me
text: React: After you take casualties for losing a round of a shootout, your opponent takes 1 casualty unless each dude in their posse has higher bullets than the highest bullets among your casualties.

title: Good Stiff Drink
text: Noon: Choose a dude's ability that has been used. That ability can be used another time.
flavor: "Got anything stronger?" - Prescott Utter

title: Point Blank
text: Resolution: Boot your stud dude in this posse. Your opponent must ace a dude in their posse with lower bullets than your dude's bullets.
flavor: At that kind of range, you're shure to hit something.

title: A Secret Tunnel
text: Noon: Move your dude from one in-town deed you own to another in-town deed you own (without booting). Make another Noon play.
flavor: "It's a hoot watchin' the schoolmarm chasin' them 'Jackelope Gang' kids around town!" - Prescott Utter

title: Joker (red)
text:
This card is only used for draw hands and pulls.
You choose its suit and value. Ace the joker after use.

title: Joker (black)
text:
This card is only used for draw hands and pulls.
You choose its suit and value. Ace the joker after use.

title: Gunslinger
text: Cannot be included in decks. Remove this token from the game after this shootout.

title: Dulf Zug
flavor: "Right this way, folks, right this way.  Anatomical wonders of all sorts await the intrepid among you.  The Big Top show may be over, but I assure you… you ain't seen nothin' yet."

title: Slade Lighbody
text: React: After Slade fails a Hex pull, pull again and use that value instead. Ace the Hex after applying its effects (if any).

title: Rafi Hamid
text: Shootout: One or more of your Deputies in any location(s) joins your posse at a Government deed (moving if necessary).
flavor: "Kings rise and fall all the time.  My only concern is to see tradition live on in Gomorra."

title: Wylie Jenks
text: Wylie has +1 bullet for each wanted dude in the opposing posse.
flavor: "There ain't nothin' Wylie and Bramble can't track." - Lucy Clover

title: Kyle Wagner
text: Noon, Boot: If Kyle is at a Ranch, unboot the Ranch. Its abilities may be used an additional time this turn.
flavor: "Kyle, are Eustace's devices working?" - Lillian Morgan

title: Lillian Morgan
text: When Lillian enters a posse, place 3 ghost rock on her. The ghost rock may be used to pay for Shootout abilities (it is not a bounty). Discard her unused ghost rock after the shootout. Shootout, Pay X Ghost Rock: X of your dudes in any location(s) join Lillian's posse (moving if necessary).

title: Ulysses Marks
text: While Ulysses is at a Saloon, the Saloon gets 1 additional control point. Noon: If Ulysses is at a Saloon, move another dude at the same location to the town square booted.

title: Alice Stowe
text: If one of your wanted dudes accepts a call-out, Alice may join the posse from any location (without booting, and even while booted).
flavor: "She's never shot a man in the back.  So if I were you, I'd keep walking away… 'cause if you turn around, you're dead." - Pancho Castillo

title: Wilber Crowley
flavor: "What this town needs is a man of mah considerable experience.  Ah've held office in every town from here to Mississippi."

title: Roderick Byre
flavor: "Gomorra has long been an example of science in service to the community.  I desire only to continue that grand legacy."

title: Town Council
text: Controller React, Boot: After you win lowball, choose your dude to get +3 influence until after the first High Noon play (including passing) is resolved.
flavor: Would you please wait until we reach the time for new business!

title: The R&D Ranch
keywords: Private • Ranch • Out of Town • Experimental
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Gain 2 ghost rock and pull. If the pull is a club, discard this deed and all cards at this location.

title: Telepathy Helmet
text: If you are the Winner, this dude cannot be affected by other players' Shootout abilities. Repeat Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Look at a player's hand.
flavor: Great Scott!

title: Faithful Hound
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose a goods in the opposing posse and pull. If the pull is lower than the value of the goods, discard the goods.
flavor: "That's a goo' boy!" - Wylie Jenks

title: Plasma Drill
text: Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock, Boot: Boot this Dude and choose a deed at an adjacent location to have its owner pay ghost rock equal to its production. If they cannot or do not, discard the deed (any dudes there go home booted).

title: Paralysis Mark
text: Noon Hex X, Boot: X is the value of a dude at this location. Boot the dude.
flavor: "You may have the will to fight, but you no longer have the ability." - Jonah Essex

title: Forget
text: Noon Hex 5, Boot: Choose an ability printed on a dude at this or an adjacent location. The dude cannot use the ability until after the Sundown phase.
flavor: When the circus came to town?  Well… wasn't it… you know, I don't recall.

title: Make 'em Sweat
text: Shootout: Boot your dude to reduce another dude's bullet rating by your dude's bullet rating. If their bullet rating is 0 (or less), boot them.
flavor: "I'd start prayin' if I were you." - Abram Grothe

title: Back Ways
text: Noon: Move your wanted dude to another location (without booting).
flavor: "Gomorra's full o' secrets, Sloane.  Just tell me where you want to go, and no one'll be the wiser." - Allie Hensman

title: Hired Help
text: Shootout: A 2-stud Gunslinger token enters play and joins your posse.
flavor: "Dunno where he came from, but if he can shoot, we can use him." - Lane Healey

title: Too Much Attention
text: Noon: Boot a wanted dude. Noon: Boot a card worth one or more control points.
flavor: "You must be more cautious, Tyx. There is too much at stake for these kinds of mishaps!" - Ivor Hawley

title: Leonardo "Leon" Cavallo
text: Noon, Boot: Make a Huckster skill check against the value of a dude at this or an adjacent location. If successful, boot that dude.
flavor: "You have to admire his dedication to his craft.  Most would blanch at teaching our clowns the art." - Ivor Hawley

title: Richard Slavin
text: Noon, Boot: If Richard is out of town, pull. If the pull is red, search your discard pile or Boot Hill for a Mystical goods and add it to your hand.
flavor: "We must assist Mr. Slavin in every way possible." - Ivor Hawley

title: Mortimer Parsons
text: If Mortimer is in your posse when you reveal an illegal draw hand, send him home booted and reduce his influence to 0 until after Sundown. If you have no other dudes in your posse, the shootout immediately ends.
flavor: "I respect his honesty.  Mr. Byre seems to have had quite  an effect on him." - Abram Grothe

title: Gang Yi
text: Shootout: Swap Gang Yi with one of your dudes in a posse that is opposing a wanted dude (Gang Yi joins the posse; the other dude moves to Gang Yi's location and is no longer in the posse).

title: Tallulah "Lula" Morgan
text: Noon Boot, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Gain ghost rock equal to the production of a deed you control but do not own.
flavor: "It's Miss Morgan. Mrs. Morgan is the Jezebel who married my father."

title: Dr. Emanuel Ashbel
text: React: When a dude is aced, pull. If the pull is higher than the dude's value, discard them instead.
flavor: "Open wide and say 'Ahh.' "

title: Angélica Espinosa
text: Shootout: Angélica joins a posse at an adjacent location without moving or booting.
flavor: "Sloane, I've seen this woman shoot.  The job won't even be a challenge." - Jonah Essex

title: José Morales
text: While in a shootout, José gains a bonus to his Huckster skill equal to his bullet rating.
flavor: "José and Jonah are like night and day.  Both are powerful, but one is bright and warm, the other is cold and dark." - Pancho Castillo

title: Genesee "Gina" Tailfeathers
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, discard a card from your play hand to draw 2 cards.
flavor: "Ironically, men would fare better if they watched her more closely." - Jonah Essex

title: Mario Crane
text: If you reveal a legal draw hand, Mario cannot be chosen as a casualty unless you lose this shootout round by 3 or more ranks.

title: Hustings
text: All dudes not controlled by this deed's controller have -1 influence while unbooted at home.
flavor: "Can you feel it, Sheriff?  They are excited.  The people want a leader.  You and I made that happen." - Rafi Hamid

title: Surveyor's Office
text: This deed is considered adjacent to all out of town deeds. Controller Noon, Boot: Move your dude from this location to an adjacent location.

title: Baird's Build and Loan
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Play a deed (as shoppin'), reducing its cost by 2 ghost rock.
flavor: "Ah, Mr. Healey, do you have another bundle of cash to pay off the remainder of your debt?" - Mr. Baird

title: Ballot Counter
text: This dude gets an influence bonus equal to the number of influence counters on this card. Discard all influence counters on this card at the end of the Upkeep phase. Repeat Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Add an influence counter to this card.

title: Holy Wheel Gun
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. That dude gets -1 bullets. If that dude is an Abomination, they must be chosen as the first casualty (if possible).

title: Stone Idol
text: Noon/Shootout, Boot: Give a dude -3 Value (to a minimum of 1).
flavor: "There is nothing you can possess that I cannot take away." - Richard Slavin

title: Corporeal Twist
text: Shootout Hex 4, Boot: One opposing dude gets -1 bullets and -2 value. If that dude is aced or discarded during this shootout, this Huckster permanently gains 1 control point.
flavor: "The advantage is mine for the taking." - Jonah Essex

title: Fetch
text: Cheatin' Resolution Hex 5, Boot: You may place a card from your draw hand into your play hand after resolution. If this is a shootout, you suffer 3 less casualties this round.
flavor: I've always wanted one of these!

title: ...It's who you know
text: Noon: One of your dudes calls out an opposing dude at their location. All dudes in both posses use their influence rather than their bullet rating for the shootout (but keep their bullet type). Your dude becomes a stud for this shootout.

title: Horse Wranglin'
text: Noon: Search your deck and/or discard pile for a Horse. You may attach it to one of your unbooted dudes (paying all costs).
flavor: "Always better when you cut them out yourself." - Jon Longstride

title: It's Not What You Know...
text: Resolution: Lower a player's draw hand by 1 rank. Cheatin' Resolution: Lower a player's draw hand by 4 ranks.

title: The Brute
text: When aced to cover casualties in a shootout, reduce the remaining casualties you must cover by 2.
flavor: "He's too stupid to be controlled, but he can be aimed." - Ivor Hawley

title: Smiling Tom
text: Tom can only move to your home or to a location that has another Fourth Ring dude.
flavor: "Thomas has gone off wandering again!" - Kevin Wainwright

title: Philip Swinford (Exp.1)
text: Each time an opposing player reveals an illegal draw hand and you do not, you may draw a card then discard a card.
flavor: "Dave, if you won't act against those longriders, I will."

title: Drew Beauman
text: Each time a player reveals an illegal draw hand and you do not, Drew may immediately attempt to invent a Gadget without booting (other requirements of inventing must still be met).

title: Dr. Arden Gillman
text: Shootout, Boot: Arden makes a mad scientist skill check against an opposing dude's grit. If successful, send that dude home booted. If successful by 6 or more, ace the dude. If the pull is a spade or a joker, Arden suffers the same fate.

title: Arvid Mardh
text: React: After Arvid enters play, make a tradin' Noon play.
flavor: "Something about watching him work makes even me angry." - Max Baine

title: Allie Hensman (Exp.1)
text: Noon Job, Boot: Allie leads a job that marks an opposing dude. If successful, the mark's controller must give you ghost rock equal to the mark's influence. If the player cannot or does not, discard the mark.
flavor: "Glad that's over.  The good girl act was gettin' old fast."

title: Milt Clemons
text: Whenever Milt's bounty increases, gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "He talks tough, but one of these days we might see how the cat jumps." - Pancho Castillo

title: Jake Smiley
text: Jake has +2 influence during the Sundown phase.
flavor: "Now, you're all probably wondering where your investments went.  Well, it's a funny story…"

title: QUATERMAN
text: QUATERMAN must be invented by a Mad Scientist like any other gadget. It enters play at the Mad Scientist's location (but does not attach). QUATERMAN's bullets cannot be modified except by attached goods. Cards cannot move or boot QUATERMAN.

title: Angela Payne
text: Noon, Boot: If Angela is at a deed you do not own, gain 2 ghost rock.
flavor: "Bottom line is she's a mercenary.  But she's protecting the townsfolk from Sloane, and I can respect that." - Abram Grothe

title: The Mayor's Office
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Raise or lower the influence of a dude at this or an adjacent location by 1.
flavor: "Honestly, it's just a chair… though a really nice one." - Rafi Hamid

title: Hunter Protections
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Boot your dude without a control point at this location. Raise their bounty by 2. They permanently get 1 control point.
flavor: "They're just a front for Sloane's Gang, Dave.  We need to shut them down." - Philip Swinford

title: The Evidence
text: Noon: Reduce a wanted dude's bounty to 0. Discard this card. Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Raise the bounty on a dude by 2. Ace this card.
flavor: "What more do you need, Dave?!" - Philip Swinford

title: Teleportation Device
text: After this gadget is invented, attach it to a deed that you control. Repeat Controller Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Choose your dude at this location and pull. If the pull is a club, discard the dude. Otherwise, move your dude to another location (without booting).

title: Mayfair Family Deck
text: This dude has Huckster 0. If this card leaves this dude, discard all Hexes from this dude.
flavor: "Its former owner is presumed dead.  It will serve me well." - Ivor Hawley

title: Puppet
text: Noon Hex X, Boot: X is the grit of a dude at this location. Take control of the dude until after the Sundown phase.

title: Summoning
text: Noon Hex 5: If successful, mark the town square for a job. If the job succeeds, immediately play an Abomination from your hand reducing its cost by 6 ghost rock (paying all other costs). The Abomination permanently gets 1 control point.

title: Ridden Down
text: Noon: Boot your Horse to send a dude without a Horse at this location home booted.
flavor: "It's rare for Healey and I to be on the same side, but I hope he catches those varmints." - Dave Montreal

title: Tail Between Yer Legs
text: React: After your call-out is accepted, the mark must form their posse before you form yours. The mark has -2 bullets (until the end of the shootout).
flavor: "You cowards!" - Lucy Clover

title: Election Day Slaughter
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark the town square. Each other player may unboot a dude in town. If successful, each other player must ace one of their dudes in town.
flavor: "In the end, the sheriff being there didn't matter much at all." - Jonah Essex

title: Oddities of Nature
text: Your Abomination dudes get +1 influence while in the town square. Noon, Boot: Boot your Abomination in the town square to gain 1 ghost rock. Boot an opposing dude in the town square.

title: The Arsenal
text: Noon, Repeat: Boot a Gadget or spell attached to your dude to have them call out an unbooted or wanted dude (at your dude's location).

title: Morgan Gadgetorium
text: React, Boot: Before pulling for a skill check, increase the difficulty by 2. If successful, gain one ghost rock, and unboot the dude if they booted to use the skill or ability.

title: Desolation Row
text: Your dudes with 4 or more bounty are worth +1 control point. Noon Job: Boot this card (not the job's leader) to mark the town square. If successful and your leader is still in the posse, give them 2 bounty then gain ghost rock equal to their bullet rating, to a maximum of 4.

title: Pagliaccio
text: Shootout, Boot: One opposing dude gets -1 bullets and -1 value.
flavor: "They key is to learn from your mistakes.  Hopefully, you're learning a lot today!" - Leon Cavallo

title: Valeria Batten
text: Valeria can invent Mystical gadgets using her Huckster skill (as if it were Mad Scientist).
flavor: "Knowledge can enlighten even the darkest soul.  I hope."

title: Micah Ryse (Exp.1)
text: Shootout: Boot a Hex or Mystical goods attached to Micah to give an opposing dude -3 value.
flavor: "Surprise."

title: Rev. Perry Inbody
text: Noon, Boot: Perry makes a Blessed skill check of difficulty 9. If successful, unboot Perry and a Law Dog at this or an adjacent location.
flavor: "Lift your soul, lift your feet, and take a walk with me."

title: Zoe Halbrook
text:
Zoe can only invent Weapon Gadget cards.
Zoe gets a bonus to her Mad Scientist skill equal to the number of Deputies at her location.

title: Abram Grothe (Exp.1)
text: Abram cannot use his ability in the first round of a shootout. Shootout: Abram gets +1 bullets. Boot all Weapons in the opposing posse and reduce their bullet bonuses to 0.

title: William Specks
text: Noon, Boot: Play a Ranch or Out of Town deed (as Shoppin'), or invent a Gadget. Reduce the cost by William's Mad Scientist skill.
flavor: "You ain't seen nothin' yet!'

title: Chuan "Jen" Qí
text:
While Jen has a Horse, she gets +1 influence.
While Jen has a Gadget, she gets +2 bullets.
flavor: "I'd like to see you mount these guns on a 'real' horse."

title: Lane Healey (Exp.1)
text: Noon: Boot Lane's Horse to choose an opposing dude at an adjacent deed. Boot that dude. Lane moves to that deed and calls out the chosen dude.
flavor: "Nice haul, bandit.  Split it with me, and I never saw you."

title: The Fixer
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, discard five cards from your deck. You may place one of those cards in your hand. If that card was an action card that starts a job, unboot The Fixer.

title: Maria Kingsford
text: Add Maria's bounty to each Huckster skill check she makes while in a shootout.
flavor: "No more creeping in the shadows.  No more illusions.  It's time to take a stand."

title: Makaio Kaleo, Esq.
text: Noon: Move one bounty from one of your dudes to another of your dudes.
flavor: "I'll plan Blackwood's defense long enough for you to mount an offense, Sloane.  This  is a fight that can't be won, but I can draw a trial out indefinitely if I need to."

title: Sister Lois Otwell
text: Shootout: Boot a Miracle on Sister Lois to give a dude in your posse +1 bullet and +3 value.
flavor: "Come in peace to the Lord."

title: Félix Amador
text: Noon: Boot a Miracle attached to Félix to look at the top card of your deck.
flavor: "Vamonos con Dios"

title: Nicodemus Whateley
text: While your dudes are at in-town deeds, they gain the ability: "Noon, Boot: If this dude has 1 or more influence, give Nicodemus a control point." At the end of Sundown, or if he is ever at home, Nicodemus loses all his control points.

title: Pettigrew's Pawnshop
text: After a player plays a non-Gadget goods, this deed's controller gains 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "No, I don't have what you want.  But I have just what you need." - Pettigrew

title: California Tax Office
text: Comes into play booted. Controller Noon, Boot: Choose another player's dude. The dude's owner either pays the dude's upkeep or discards that dude. Reduce the dude's upkeep to 0 until after the next Upkeep phase.
flavor: "Now there's only one sure thing in life." - Avie Cline

title: St. Anthony's Chapel
text:
Abominations at this location get -1 bullets.
The controller's dudes get +1 to their skill ratings while at this deed
flavor: "God grant our request if it be for the good of our souls."

title: The Whateley Estate
text: Dudes not controlled by this deed's owner boot after moving here. Controller Noon, Boot: Move a non-dude card from your Boot Hill to your discard pile.
flavor: Evil never dies.

title: Outlaw Mask
text: While in the town square, this dude gets a bonus to their influence equal to their bounty.
flavor: "Before, their fear made them hunt me.  Now, their fear makes them run." - Maria Kingsford

title: Clown Carriage
text: React, Boot: When forming or joining a posse, this dude and unbooted Abominations at this dude's location do not have to boot to join the posse (this does not allow a booted dude to join a posse). Shootout, Boot: Play an Abomination from your hand into your posse (paying all costs).

title: Bio-Charged Neutralizer
text: This dude is a stud. This card cannot be traded, and is not affected by other players' card effects.
flavor: "Great science demands great sacrifice." - Prof. Eustace True

title: Evanor
text: If there is an unbooted non-Melee Weapon in the opposing posse, this goods provides no bullet bonus. Shootout, Boot: If this dude is Blessed, they cannot be a casualty in the next round of the shootout (they are not protected this round). If you win this round, the loser takes 1 additional casualty.

title: Mirror, Mirror
text: Shootout Hex 4, Boot: This Huckster's bullet type becomes that of an opposing dude. If this Huckster has a lower bullet rating, they get a bullet bonus equal to the difference in ratings. Shootout Hex 6, Boot: An opposing dude's bullet type becomes that of this Huckster. If this Huckster has a lower bullet rating, that dude suffers a bullet penalty equal to the difference in ratings.

title: Lay On Hands
text: React Miracle 8, Boot: When another dude at this or an adjacent location is being discarded as a casualty, or aced (at any time), boot this Blessed. Send that dude home booted instead. That dude will not unboot during the Sundown phase at the end of this turn.

title: Holy Roller
text: Shootout Miracle 6, Boot: This Blessed gets +1 bullet and cannot be chosen as a casualty during this round of the shootout unless you lose by 3 or more hand ranks.

title: The Lord Provides
text: Shootout Miracle 9, Boot: Boot this blessed. Search your deck and/or discard pile for an action card, reveal it, and place it in your hand. Discard this spell.
flavor: "Would ya looky here!"

title: Phantasm
text: Noon Hex 9, Boot: Choose another player's unbooted dude at this or an adjacent location. Move them to a location adjacent to where they are now (without booting). Noon Hex 12, Boot: Move another player's booted dude at this location to an adjacent location.
flavor: "You can't flee from your imagination." - Ivor Hawley

title: Walk the Path
text: Noon Miracle 6, Boot: Move another one of your dudes to this Blessed's location (from any location, without booting). Shootout Miracle 7, Boot: One of your dudes in any location joins this Blessed's posse (moving if necessary). Unboot that dude.

title: Soothe
text: Noon Miracle 10, Boot: Boot this blessed to unboot another dude at this or an adjacent location.
flavor: "Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest." - Joshua 1:9

title: Swinford Finds Trouble
text: Shootout: Boot one or more dudes in your posse. As you boot each dude, choose a dude in the opposing posse with a lower bullet rating. Boot the chosen dude, or send them home if they are already booted.

title: Under the Weather
text: Noon: Choose a dude and pull. If the pull equals or exceeds their grit, boot them. If it exceeds their grit by 6 or more, send them home booted.
flavor: "I don't need no doctor.  It's just a tummy ache."

title: Faster on the Draw
text: Shootout: Your dude gets +1 bullets. If they are a Deputy, they become a stud. One opposing dude gets -2 bullets.
flavor: "You're gonna need to be faster than that if you want to last long in this town." - Xiong "Wendy" Cheng

title: This'll Hurt in the Mornin'
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Choose and discard one or two cards in an opponent's illegal hand. Replace them with cards drawn from the top of their owner's deck. If your hand is legal, then for each card discarded, your opponent must either pay you 1 ghost rock or ace the card.

title: Prayer
text: Noon: Choose one of your dudes, who can attach Miracles as a shootout play and at any location. If the dude is not Blessed, they gain Blessed 0, but must discard all attached miracles after Sundown.
flavor: "As I lay me down to sleep…"

title: Meet The New Boss
text: Noon Job: Mark the town square. If successful, your leader permanently gets +1 influence and 1 control point. Ace this card whether or not the job succeeds.
flavor: "I wouldn't make that murderous warlock a dogcatcher, let alone mayor." - Xiong "Wendy" Cheng

title: Funtime Freddy
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, ace Freddy. Search your deck for two different Hexes and reveal them. The player on your left chooses one to ace. Attach the other to one of your Hucksters (paying all costs). Discard a card.

title: The Flying Popescus
text: While The Popescus have two (or more) Hexes attached, they get +1 influence. Shootout: If the Popescus have a Mystical goods attached, they become a stud.

title: Andrew Burton
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, discard a card, draw a card, and add one bounty to another player's dude.

title: Elmore Rhine
text: Noon, Boot: Choose another player's dude at a deed they do not own. Gain ghost rock equal to their bounty.
flavor: "You know, I lived the law every day... in the courts and the jails of New York City."

title: Howard Aswell
text: React: At the start of the game, if there are no deeds in your hand, reveal it and discard the top 10 cards from your deck. You may discard a card from your hand to put a Ranch or Improvement from your discard pile into your hand.

title: Louis Pasteur
text: Repeat Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Make a Mad Scientist skill test against a difficulty of 10. If successful, unboot one of your dudes at this or an adjacent location.
flavor: "Fortune Favors the prepared mind."

title: Benny McGill
text: Noon: Boot a Hex on Benny to call out a dude with a higher bullet rating at this location, who cannot refuse.

title: Marion Seville (Exp.1)
text: Shootout: If Marion has a Melee Weapon attached, he becomes a stud and you may boot a Weapon in the opposing posse.
flavor: "The last person to call 'Francine' a pig-sticker was trussed up like a side of bacon. I see a pattern here." - Pancho Castillo

title: J.W. Byrne
text:
While J.W. has a Weapon attached, he gets +1 bullets.
While J.W. has an Attire attached, he gets +1 influence.
While J.W. has a Horse attached, he gets –1 upkeep.

title: Shane & Graves Security
text: Controller Shootout, Boot: A 2-stud Gunslinger token joins your posse at this or an adjacent deed. Remove the Gunslinger token from the game after the shootout.

title: Gomorra Jail
text: You may start with this deed in play in place of one Law Dogs dude. Controller React, Boot: When another player's wanted dude is discarded during the High Noon phase, this deed gains a permanent control point.

title: Diable en Boite
text: React, Boot: When this dude is aced or discarded in a shootout, send one dude in this shootout home booted and draw a card.
flavor: "I love it! They know it's coming, yet they're surprised every time." - Ivor Hawley

title: Legal Instruments
text:
This card attaches to an unbooted in-town deed you control.
This deed gains the Government keyword. Deputies at this deed get +2 influence and +3 value.
flavor: "Not the solemn cathedral of justice I prefer, but it'll do." - Judge Harry Somerset

title: Recursive Motion Machine
text: If this dude is a Gadget, it gets –1 upkeep. You may use ghost rock on this card to pay for abilities on Gadgets at this location. React, Boot: After this dude moves, put one ghost rock on this card (it is not a bounty).

title: Winchester Model 1873
text: Shootout, Boot: Boot this dude to give them +1 bullets and make them a stud.
flavor: " 'One of One Hundred,' eh? Mighty thoughtful of 'em to put my name on it for me." - Lane Healey

title: Fancy New Hat
text: Abilities on other players' cards cannot reduce this dude's influence.
flavor: "Who's got two thumbs and a fancy new hat?" - Mortimer Parsons

title: Confession
text: Noon Miracle 6, Boot: Boot this dude to choose a dude at this or an adjacent location, who gains bounty equal to this dude's Blessed skill. Noon Miracle 7, Boot: Transfer one bounty from a dude at this or an adjacent location to your stash.

title: Shield of Faith
text: Shootout Miracle 7, Boot: Dudes cannot be aced or discarded during this shootout, except as a casualty for losing the round or due to their owner's card abilities or traits. Reduce your casualties this round by 1.
flavor: "The lord is my strength and my shield..." - Psalm 28:7

title: Rope and Ride
text: React: After a dude accepts your callout, but before posses are formed, boot your leader or their attached Horse to move your dude then the mark to an adjacent location that is not your home. Boot the mark.
flavor: "Hope you like the scenic route." - Sanford Taylor

title: Incubation
text: While this card is attached, this dude gets –1 bullets, –1 influence, –3 value, and the ability, "Noon, Boot: Discard one attached Incubation." Noon: Attach this card to a booted dude at their home.

title: Flight of the Lepus
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Choose up to two dudes controlled by you or the player with an illegal draw hand. If you revealed a legal hand, you may choose one additional dude. Move those dudes home. If this is a shootout, you may boot them.

title: Avie Cline (Exp.1)
text: Noon, Boot: If Avie is at a deed in town, choose an opposing dude with lower influence in town. Move them to Avie's location.

title: Judge Harry Somerset (Exp.1)
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark a wanted dude. A 2-stud Gunslinger token enters play booted and joins your posse. If successful, discard the mark. Remove the Gunslinger from the game after the job.
flavor: "I hereby sentence you to hang by the neck until dead!"

title: Ebenezer Springfield
text: React: After another player's ability affects your dude at this or an adjacent location, add one bounty to one of that player's dudes who is not wanted.
flavor: "The good Lord gave me a second chance. I can help you find one too."

title: Elander Boldman (Exp.1)
text: Shootout, Boot: Unboot a Gadget. You can use its abilities another time. If it's Experimental, unboot Elander. If it's a Weapon, it provides an extra +1 bullets and its dude becomes a stud.

title: Antheia Pansofia
text: If you pull a club while making a Huckster skill test for someone in Antheia's posse, add 3 to the skill check.
flavor: "Being told I shouldn't study something just makes me want to know about it more."

title: Harry Highbinder
text: Harry cannot attach Weapons. While Harry is at the town square and you have more influence there than any other player, you control the town square (it has no keywords).
flavor: "Oh, by all means, Deputy. Tell me how you think this is gonna work."

title: Max Baine (Exp.1)
text: If Max is at the town square or a Government deed, Ranches provide no control points. Noon, Boot: Play a dude with a value of 10 or higher at Max's location, reducing their cost by 3 ghost rock (minimum 0).
flavor: "I won't do it again, Lillian. I'm done."

title: El Grajo
text: Shootout: Boot a Melee Weapon attached to El Grajo to make him a stud and give him +2 bullets, to a maximum rating of 4 bullets.
flavor: "I speak for those whose lives have been taken unjustly. I am El Grajo."

title: Jacqueline Isham
text: Repeat React: When Jacqueline joins a mark's posse, or a posse opposing a job, she becomes a stud.
flavor: "Stand back, sir. I'll take care of this one."

title: Huntsmen's Society
text: The controller's dudes at this and adjacent locations with a value of 10 or higher get -1 upkeep.
flavor: In a world of maze dragons, wendigo, ghouls, and dread wolves, their biggest concern is deciding what really is the most dangerous game.

title: Secured Stockyard
text: This deed must be invented by an in-town Mad Scientist. It enters play like a deed. Controller Noon, Boot: Gain one ghost rock.

title: La Quema
text: This dude gets +3 value. While this dude has a Melee Weapon, they get +1 bullets. Shootout, Boot: This dude joins your posse (moving if necessary). Boot an opposing dude.
flavor: "Among men, El Grajo. Among horses, La Quema."

title: Asyncoil Gun
text: Shootout, Boot: Pull. If it's a club, discard this dude. If not, discard an opposing dude with value less than or equal to this dude's bullets.
flavor: "Overcharge? What do you mean, overcha-"

title: Scoop Hound
text: Shootout, Boot: Shootout plays cannot bring dudes into either posse or send dudes home booted (they remain in the posse without booting).
flavor: "Can't I at least get to the outhouse in peace?" -Sheriff Dave Montreal

title: Rapier
text:
If there is an unbooted non-Melee Weapon in the opposing posse, Rapier provides +0 bullets.
This dude gets +1 value.
flavor: "For me it is a weapon. For El Grajo, it is a paint brush." -Abram Grothe

title: Vitality Tonic
text: This dude gains the Abomination keyword. React: When this dude is aced in a shootout, discard them instead. Repeat Noon, Pay 2 Ghost Rock: Pull. If the pull is a club, discard this dude. If not, unboot them.
flavor: "Perfection!" -Dr. Dawn Edwards

title: Consecration
text: Cheatin' Resolution Miracle 7: One of your dudes gets +2 bullets and +2 influence and becomes a stud until after Sundown. If this is a shootout, reduce your casualties this round by 3.

title: Mark of Pestilence
text: Shootout Hex 9, Boot: Boot all other unbooted dudes.
flavor:
"The first is clad in showy and garish attire. As he rides, he bends his bow to spread pestilence before him, his poison arrows festering with the seeds of all diseases." -Ludwig Kahler
De Annulos Mysteriis, 1487

title: Cookin' Up Trouble
text: Noon: Look at another player's hand. If that player has revealed an illegal draw hand this turn, you may choose one action, goods or spell card in their hand that does not have a Cheatin' ability. Discard that card.
flavor: "Don't worry pets... It's almost time." -Jonah Essex

title: Ol' Fashioned Hangin'
