text: Noon Job: Mark a wanted dude with at least 2 bounty. If successful, ace the mark; also, your leader (if still in play) permanently gets 1 control point.
flavor: "When the facts conflicts with the legend, hang the legend." -Judge Harry Somerset

title: No Turning Back
text: Noon: Ace a dude you own and control to gain ghost rock equal to their cost. Resolution: Ace a dude you own and control to reduce your casualties this round to zero. Choose a dude who gets +2 bullets and becomes a stud for the remainder of the Shootout. Your dudes cannot flee this round.
flavor: "I'll burn 'em all for this!" -Sloane

title: Junior
text: Junior cannot be aced by card abilities. React: When Junior enters play during High Noon, you may search your deck and discard pile for a non-Gadget Mystical goods and either ace it or attach it to one of your dudes in this location (paying all costs).

title: The Fabulous Mister Miss
text: Whenever a dude refuses a call out from Mister Miss, that dude gets -3 influence until after Sundown.
flavor: "He's more man than you'll ever be, and more woman than you'll ever have!" -Dulf Zug

title: Sister Mary Gideon
text: While Mary is the only dude in your posse, she gets +1 bullets for each dude in the opposing posse.
flavor: "Some worry about the sisters, sayin' it's too easy for some outlaw to bust in and cause trouble. Part of me can't wait to see 'em try." -Abram Grothe

title: Nathan Shane
text: Shootout, Boot: Look at a number of random cards in an opponent's hand up to Nathan's bullet value. You may discard one action card you saw.
flavor: "Graves and I go back a long way, Mrs. Morgan. We know a bit 'bout loyalty. So when we say we're with ya, believe it."

title: Warren Graves
text: React: When a shootout play aces, discards, or sends another of your dudes home booted, send them home booted instead. Warren joins the posse (moving if necessary).

title: Jack O'Hara
text: Jack can have two Weapons attached.
flavor: "Jack was mi amigo from way back. I thought this operation could use some classing up." -Pancho Castillo

title: John "Aces" Radcliffe
text: John cannot attach Weapons. After each shootout play (including passing), if you have more cards in your hand than each other player (individually), John becomes a stud. If not, John becomes a draw.

title: Steele Archer (Exp.1)
text: Noon: Unboot a Hex at this or an adjacent location. Its abilities may be used an additional time.
flavor: "At no time do my fingers leave my hands."

title: Old Man McDroste
text: While at an Out of Town deed, McDroste is worth 1 control point. While McDroste is at a deed, reduce its production by 3 (minimum 0). Noon, Boot: Choose a dude at this deed. Reduce their influence to 0 until after the next Upkeep phase.
flavor: "Ha! I'm dancin' on yer grave, Poverty!"

title: Flint's Amusements
text: Each time a Resolution ability on an action card is used, the controller gains one ghost rock. Controller Noon, Boot: If you played a Cheatin' Resolution this turn, draw a card.

title: Lula's Exploit
text:
During the Upkeep phase, add or remove ghost rock from this deed so that it has two ghost rock on it.
The controller may use ghost rock from this deed to pay for abilities on Gadgets.

title: Testing Range
text: Controller React, Boot, Pay 2 Ghost Rock: After a Mad Scientist succeeds at inventing a Gadget, unboot them. Controller React, Boot: After you pull a club for an Experimental card ability, ignore the result and pull again.
flavor: "I'm absolutely certain it will work. Totally. At least 85% sure." Zoe Halbrook

title: Dog's Duster
text: While they are not wanted, this dude gets +1 influence. If this dude is a Deputy, they do not become wanted for joining a posse at a private location. Noon, Boot: If this dude is unbooted, call out a wanted dude (at this location).

title: Stoker's Sabre
text: If there is an unbooted non-Melee Weapon in the opposing posse, Stoker's Sabre provides +0 bullets. This dude gets +3 value. Shootout, Boot: Unboot a spell attached to this dude. You may use its abilities an additional time this turn.

title: Fate Dispenser
text: After this is invented, attach it to an in-town deed you control. Controller Noon, Boot: If your hand has fewer cards than your maximum hand size, draw a card.
flavor: "'They'll never forgive you'? What kind of fortune is that?" -Clementine Lepp

title: Soul Cage
text: Cheatin' Resolution, Boot: Choose an Abomination from your discard pile or Boot Hill with a cost equal to or lower than the illegal hand's rank. Put it into play at this location at no ghost rock cost. If this is a shootout, it joins your posse.

title: For Such a Time as This
text: Noon Miracle 9, Boot: If successful, mark the town square for a job. This dude is the leader. If the job succeeds, search your deck and discard pile for a dude whose grit is less than this Miracle's skill check. Play that dude, reducing their cost by 4. That dude permanently gets +1 influence. Ace this card.

title: Sword of the Spirit
text: Noon Miracle 7: Choose a dude with a Melee Weapon. While they have that Weapon (this turn), they have +1 bullets, become a stud, and cannot be affected by opposing spells.

title: A Fight They'll Never Forget
text: Shootout: Each dude in your posse gets +1 bullets. After each time any dude is aced as a casualty, the shooter in the other posse permanently gets 1 control point. Ace this card.

title: Buried Treasure
text: Noon: Ace a card in your discard pile to gain 3 ghost rock and draw a card.
flavor: "I'm tellin' ya, I seen that sword before. Baine dug it right outta the garbage and just hung it over the mantelpiece!" -Ulysses Marks

title: Nightmare at Noon
text: Shootout: Each dude in one posse gets -1 bullets. Each dude in the shootout with 0 or 1 bullets becomes a draw.
flavor: "I don't know what to shoot first!" -Silas Aims

title: The 108 Righteous Bandits
text: Noon, Boot: Move your dude to the location of another of your Dudes (without booting, and even if booted).

title: Eagle Wardens
text: Noon, Boot: Boot your dude at the Town Square to draw two cards. If that dude has 2 or more influence, draw one additional card. Discard or ace a card in your hand.

title: Benjamin Washington
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, discard one or more cards from your hand. For each card you discard, one dude gets -2 upkeep (to a minimum of 0) until High Noon. Draw a card.

title: Daomei Wang
text: React: After Daomei Wang comes into play during High Noon, move one of your other dudes to another location (without booting).
flavor: "I'll keep an eye on him, but I am pretty sure he's keeping an eye on me too." -Gang Yi

title: Randall
text: While Randall is at a location with two or more other dudes (any players'), your maximum hand size is increased by one.
flavor: "I'm just a humble spinner of tales."

title: Xiaodan Li
text: Xiaodan does not count toward the number of dudes in your starting posse.
flavor: "It's amazing the places that little guy can get into... and out of." -T'ou Chi Chow

title: Longwei Fu
text: While Longwei is at home, your posse has an extra +1 stud bonus (at any location, even if Longwei is not in the posse).
flavor: "I guess he used to be some big general under the Emperor. Now they don't want anything to do with him. Fits in perfectly with Chow's bunch." -Jonah Essex

title: Natalya
text: At the start of the Upkeep phase, if you have less ghost rock in your stash than each other player, you gain the production of the deed at Natalya's location this turn, and other players do not.
flavor: "My spirit can be put to rest with an offering of... let's say five bucks."

title: Xui Yin Chen
text: Shootout, Boot: All dudes in your posse become studs and get +1 influence.
flavor: "Honey in mouth, dagger in stomach." -Chinese proverb

title: Hamshanks
text: While Hamshanks is unbooted at a location you control, other players cannot choose or affect your dudes at this location with their abilities if they could legally choose to affect Hamshanks instead.

title: Hiram Capatch
text: Each of your other dudes at this and adjacent locations has +1 influence during the Upkeep phase.
flavor: "Just lean back and relax. By the way, have I ever told you about my friend Chow?"

title: Yunxu Jiang
text: While Yunxu is in a shootout at a location you control, each of your other dudes in the posse has +1 bullets and +1 value.

title: Abuelita Espinoza
text: While Abuelita is at a deed you do not own, each of your other dudes has -1 upkeep.
flavor: "Stealing from a child? ¡Que Malo!"

title: Bai Yang Chen
text: While Bai Yang is at another player's home, your maximum hand size is increased by two and Bai Yang has -1 upkeep.
flavor: "If my brother put half the effort into his work as he does into looking powerful, he might actually be of some help." -Xui Yin Chen

title: T'ou Chi Chow
text: If your outfit is , T'ou Chi Chow's cost is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 0) for each deed you control. Noon/Shootout, Repeat: Boot a deed you control to unboot a dude at that deed or adjacent to it.
flavor: "Gomorra's a town built on greed. I'm here to rebuild it."

title: Butch Deuces
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, look at the top 5 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Spirit or Attire from those cards to shuffle your play hand into your deck and take those cards into your play hand. Otherwise, return the cards to your deck in the same order.
flavor: "Sometimes you just gotta roll them bones."

title: Mazatl
text: Noon: Move Mazatl to a location where there is a Totem.
flavor: "Our brother from the south has many talents. We have use of them all." -Stephen Seven-Eagles

title: Marcia Ridge
text: While Marcia is in the Town Square and you have more influence there than each other player, you may use Controller abilities on adjacent deeds as if you controlled them.
flavor: "Get used to it, Sheriff. The Wardens are here to stay."

title: Richard Faulkner
flavor: "Where Stephen is from, a boy becomes a man by gathering a feather from a live eagle. Before he was old enough to get it, he saw a group of seven boys go through it and thought it was a matter of quantity. The kid came back three weeks later with seven feathers and a whole lot of cuts and scratches. That's the kind of man we're working with. 'Impossible' isn't in his vocabulary."

title: Lydia Bear-Hands
text: Resolution, Boot: Boot a Spirit on Lydia. One of your dudes gets the Harrowed keyword until the end of the shootout.
flavor: "Those who think the body is easier to heal than the spirit haven't practiced medecine out here."

title: Jackson Trouble
text: React: After Jackson moves to or from an Out of Town location, unboot him.
flavor: "No it's not his real name. Truth is, not much is known about him at all. But he's a legendary tracker." -Wylie Jenks

title: Black Elk
flavor: "He travels the boundaries between worlds, talks with the spirits often. He could probably do with spending a bit more time in this realm, but he brings back some of the best stories." -Laughing Crow

title: Bloody Teeth
flavor: "He'd like you to think he got his name from how vicious and dangerous he is and not from how often he gets punched in the mouth." -Laughing Crow

title: Three-Eyed Hawk
text:
After you attach a Sidekick to Hawk from your hand, gain 1 ghost rock.
Sidekicks attached to Hawk can be aced to cover two casualties.
flavor: "I speak with the creatures of the wild. They won't hurt you, not like people will."

title: Sarah Meoquanee
text: Shootout: If a dude in your posse has 3 or more influence, or if a Spirit is at the shootout location, Sarah joins the posse (moving if necessary) and becomes a stud.
flavor: "The cavalry? You're lookin' at her."

title: Smiling Frog
text: Noon: Discard a card to give Smiling Frog +1 bullets. If the card was a Spirit, he gets +2 bullets instead.
flavor: "Scouting for the Wardens sure beats my last job. I'd face Maze Dragons over those idiotic tourists any day."

title: Laughing Crow
text: Noon: Reveal the top two cards of your deck. You may attach any revealed Spirits, paying all costs. Discard the rest.
flavor: "Medecine is my caw-ling! Get it?"

title: Chief Stephen Seven-Eagles
text: If your outfit is , Chief Stephen's cost is reduced by 1 for each card (any player's) attached to any location(s). Noon, Boot: While at the town square, Chief Stephen is worth 1 control point for each card attached to deeds you control.

title: Nunchucks
text: Can only attach to a dude with Kung Fu. While in a posse, this dude has +1 Kung Fu. React, Boot: If this dude is in a posse, after a player pulls, reduce the pull by this dude's Kung Fu rating.

title: Idol of Tlazolteotl
text: During High Noon, this dude has +2 influence. Noon, Boot: Choose a card that you own and that is attached to a location. Attach it legally to a deed you control.

title: Spirit Guidance
text: Noon Spirit 7, Boot: Discard a card to draw a card. Noon Spirit 10, Boot: If this Shaman is not at your home, draw two cards, then discard two cards.
flavor: "Even the dead love to gossip." -Laughing Crow

title: Spirit Dance
text: Shootout Spirit 10, Boot: A 2-stud Nature Spirit token enters play and joins your posse.
flavor: "Rejoice with the spirits! Though blood be spilled, they will remain by your side!" -Black Elk

title: Spirit Trail
text: This location is adjacent to each other location that has a Spirit Trail attached. Noon Spirit 6, Boot: Move your dude from this location (without booting, and even if booted).

title: Many Speak as One
text: Noon, Spirit 9, Boot: Put a 1-Influence Ancestor Spirit Token in play at this location.
flavor: "Great chiefs of the past, guide me in forging this new path for your peoples." -Chief Seven Eagles

title: The Pack Awakens
text: Token dudes at this location gain the Harrowed keyword. Shootout Spirit 8, Boot: A 2-stud Nature Spirit enters play, booted, and joins your posse.
flavor: Wolf repays loyalty in kind.

title: Shifu Speaks
text: Noon Technique: If successful, your dude has +1 influence and +2 Kung Fu while not at home, and you may discard up to five cards from the top of your deck.
flavor: "Din boo. Now shift to sui boo." -Longwei Fu

title: Zhu's Ferocity
text: Shootout Tao Technique: If successful, this dude gets +1 bullets and an opposing dude gets -1 bullets. Combo if this dude has higer bullets than the opposing dude.

title: Raking Dragons
text: Shootout Tao Technique: If successful, choose a dude. Boot that dude and give them -2 value. Combo if the affected dude has lower value than this dude.

title: Rabbit's Lunar Leap
keywords: Technique • Tao of the Jade Rabbit
text: Shootout Tao Technique: If successful, move this dude into your posse. You may unboot this dude. Combo if your posse does not have more dudes than the opposing posse.

title: Zhu's Reward
text: Shootout Tao Technique, Boot: If successful, all opposing dudes with value lower than this dude's bullets are sent home booted.
flavor: "Zhu's end may lead to great wisdom, but mostly it's just my favorite part." -Longwei Fu

title: Ancestor Spirit
text:
Cannot be included in decks.
Remove this token from the game if it leaves this location, or at the end of the turn.

title: Nature Spirit
text:
Cannot be included in decks.
Remove this token from the game after this shootout.

title: The Sanatorium
text: Noon, Boot: Choose your dude and another dude at the same or adjacent location. Your dude gets either +1 influence or +1 Huckster skill. The other dude gets –1 bullets and –1 value.

title: Abram's Crusaders
text: Your Deputies with a Melee Weapon have +1 bullets. Your Deputies with a Miracle have +1 influence. Noon, Boot: One of your dudes gains the Deputy keyword.

title: Den of Thieves
text: Your starting posse may contain up to two Grifters. Your Grifters each have their cost reduced by 1. React, Boot: When draw hands are revealed, add 1 bounty to one of your Grifters to increase your hand rank by 1. Your hand is considered illegal. Gain 1 Ghost Rock.

title: Asakichi Cooke
text: Noon: Discard a card. Move one of your other dudes from this location (without booting, even if booted).
flavor: "When I saw what they did to that poor girl, I had to step in. She's been a daughter to me ever since." -Forster Cooke

title: Emre, The Turkish Bear
text: React: After any dude at this location pulls for a Technique, pull and use that value instead. Emre becomes a stud until the end of the turn.

title: Michael "The Badger" Dodge
text: While The Badger has a Melee Weapon, he is a stud. Shootout, Boot: Boot an opposing dude. The Badger gets –3 bullets if the opposing posse has more unbooted dudes than your posse. Pull. If the pull is not a club, the dude you booted gets –3 bullets.

title: Jim Cheveyo
text: While at the same location as a Spirit, Jim has +1 influence and is a stud.
flavor: "I never had the patience to commune with the spirits, but they seem to like me anyway."

title: Enapay
text: Enapay has +2 influence during High Noon. Noon, Boot: Another dude at this location gets +1 influence.

title: Danny Wilde
text: Danny cannot be called out by dudes with lower influence (not even through card effects).
flavor: "I've danced the Ghost Dance alongside the Paiute, rode to war with the Apache and against them. Why would I care what you think about me?"

title: Dabney Scuttlesby
text:
Dabney can only invent Mystical Gadgets.
Dabney can invent Mystical Gadgets and trade them to other dudes while in the town square.
flavor: "It's excellently adapted to carry off superfluous bile, amend appetite, and remove habitual costiveness for just $5 a bottle."

title: Ivor Hawley (Exp.1)
text: If your outfit is , Ivor's cost is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 0) for each Abomination in play and in any Boot Hill. React: After Ivor enters play from your hand, play up to two Hexes or Abominations from your Boot Hill. Reduce those cards' costs by 3 each.
flavor: "It's showtime."

title: Deborah West
text: Deborah is a stud while she is the leader (during a job or callin' out).
flavor: "You don't need eyes to see how much you need help, Brother Abram. 'Ask and ye shall receive.' "

title: Abram Grothe (Exp.2)
text: If your outfit is , Abram's cost is reduced by the total bounty on other players' dudes (to a minimum of 0). Noon/Shootout, Boot: Unboot all your Deputies at this and adjacent locations.
flavor: " 'The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?' "

title: "Dead" Billy Jones
text: Noon: If you control a Ranch, choose a dude with a Horse in this or an adjacent location. Move that dude to another location.
flavor: "I ain't goin' near them... things. Billy can look after 'em." -Jarrett Blake

title: Lillian Morgan (Exp.1)
text: If your outfit is , Lillian's cost is reduced by 1 for each Horse and Ranch you control. Noon/Shootout: Play an action from your discard pile (as if it were in your hand). After the card resolves, boot a spell on Lillian or ace that action.

title: Samantha "Sammy" Cooke
text: Noon, Boot, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: Discard a goods card attached to a dude at this location. Sammy gains 1 bounty. If the discarded goods card was a Horse, pull. If the pull is higher than the Horse's value, attach it to Sammy instead.
flavor: "If possession is 90% of the law, the other 10% is a fast horse. Now I have both."

title: Sloane (Exp.1)
text: If your outfit is , Sloane's cost is reduced by the number of wanted dudes you control. When Sloane enters play, unboot each of your wanted dudes. Sloane gets 1 bounty for each dude you unbooted.

title: Margaret Hagerty
text:
Margaret gets +3 to her Mad Scientist skill while inventing Gadget dudes.
Each Gadget dude at Margaret's location has -1 upkeep.
flavor: "Madness? No. This is the only thing that makes sense."

title: The Wretched
text: The Wretched must be invented by a Mad Scientist. It enters play at the Mad Scientist's location (but does not attach). After The Wretched enters play, ace a dude you own and control in the same location. The inventing Mad Scientist gains 2 bounty (if still in play).
flavor: "WHY?!"

title: The Extra Bet
text: React, Boot: After all players ante for lowball, add 1 additional ghost rock from your stash to the pot. After you draw your lowball hand, you may discard a card from your draw hand and replace it with the top card of your deck.

title: Morgan Mining Company
text: This deed has +1 production for each Strike you control.
flavor: "Finally! A chance to make some real money in this stinkin' cowtown." -Lula Morgan

title: Quarantine Tent
text: Dudes at this deed ignore all penalties to bullets, value, and influence (the penalties resume when the dudes leave this location). Controller Noon, Boot: Boot your dude at this location to unboot your outfit. You may use its abilities an extra time this turn.

title: Cooke's Nightcap
text: This deed has 2 control points while controlled by a player other than its owner.
flavor: "Our home away from home." -T'ou Chi Chow

title: Mutant Cattle
text: After this card is discarded as a casualty for losing a round of a shootout, the winner pulls. If they have a dude in their posse with a value lower than the pull, they must take one casualty.

title: Monte Bank
text: Cannot be traded. Monte Bank's cost is reduced by 2 when attaching it to a Grifter. A dude cannot have more than one Monte Bank attached. This dude gains the Grifter keyword (after attaching).

title: Wendy's Teethkickers
text: React, Boot: After another player's dude goes home booted from this location, this dude gets +1 influence until the end of the turn. Unboot this dude.

title: Rich Man's Guard Dog
text: You may immediately play this Gadget when another player reveals an illegal draw hand. If this Gadget is invented while you are in a shootout, attach it to a dude in your posse. Cheatin’ Resolution: Pull. If the pull is equal to or higher than the value of the opposing shooter discard them, otherwise send them home booted.

title: Fiery Rhetoric
text: Noon Job Miracle 6, Boot: Mark the town square. If successful, this dude gets control points (until the end of the turn) equal to the number of wanted dudes controlled by other players.

title: Strength of the Ancestors
text: Noon Spirit 5, Boot: This dude gets +3 bullets, becomes a stud, and other players’ card effects cannot boot them or send them home booted. These effects end if this dude leaves this location (or at the end of the turn).
flavor: "The journey of the warrior encompasses far more than physical strength." -Black Elk

title: Phantom Fingers
text: Noon/Shootout Hex 6, Boot: Choose a goods card attached to an opposing dude in this or an adjacent location. Boot it, and it loses all traits, abilities, and bullet bonuses. If it's Mystical or a Gadget, draw a card.
flavor: "A flick of the wrist and they'll never know what hit them." -Ivor Hawley

title: Dumbstruck
text: Noon/Shootout Miracle 9, Boot: This dude cannot be booted or moved by other players' card abilities. Unboot this dude.
flavor: "She can shoot a flea off a horse's ear at fifty yards... with her off hand." -Abram Grothe

title: Red Horse's Tail
text: Noon Spirit X, Boot: X is the value of a dude at this location. Boot that dude. Shootout Spirit X, Boot: X is the grit of an opposing dude. Send that dude home booted.

title: Fire of Nanahbozho
text: Can only attach to a deed. This deed gains the Holy Ground keyword. Shamans get +2 to their Shaman skill while at this deed. Noon/Shootout Spirit 10, Boot: Unboot a dude at this deed. Make another play.

title: Civil War
text: Noon: Choose two dudes controlled by the same player in one location. Their controller moves one of those dudes to another location (without booting, and even if booted).
flavor: "I'll burn this company to the ground before I give any more of it to you!" -Lillian Morgan

title: Rabbit's Deception
keywords: Technique • Tao of the Jade Rabbit
text: Shootout Tao Technique: If successful, send this dude home booted. If your dude was unbooted when you played this card, you may also send an opposing dude home booted. Combo if there is a stud in the opposing posse.

title: A Hero's Passing
text: Play only if a dude has been aced this turn. While this card is attached to your home, increase your maximum hand size by one. Discard this card when a dude you own is aced. Noon, Job: Mark your home. If successful, attach this card to your home and draw two cards.

title: Tummy Twister
text: While attached to a deed, this card attaches to the first dude to move here (the winner chooses in case of a tie). A dude with this card attached has +1 upkeep. Noon: Attach this card to a deed.
flavor: "I ain't seen a doctor in 20 years, and I ain't gonna start now!" -famous last words

title: Backroom Deals
text: React: Play when an opposing dude is discarded during the Upkeep phase. That dude remains in play instead. You control them until the end of the turn. React: Play at the start of the Upkeep phase to give one of your dudes –2 upkeep until the end of the phase.
flavor: "Nice to meet a Morgan who shares my interests." -Lane Healey

title: Forced Quarantine
text: Discard this dude at the end of the turn. Noon Job, Boot: Mark an opposing dude whose current influence, bullets, or value are lower than their printed values. If successful, boot the mark, attach this card to them, and your leader gets one permanent control point.

title: Devil's Joker (Red)
text: This card is used only for draw hands and pulls. You choose its suit and value. While this card is in your draw hand, your hand is illegal. Increases your hand rank by 2. Ace the joker after use.

title: Devil's Joker (Black)
text: This card is used only for draw hands and pulls. You choose its suit and value. While this card is in your draw hand, your hand is illegal. Increases your hand rank by 2. Ace the joker after use.

title: 108 Worldly Desires
text: Repeat React: After you draw a draw hand, if you have less ghost rock than all other players, draw an additional card into your draw hand and then discard a card. You can only use this ability once per draw hand.

title: Beyond the Veil
text: While your dudes are at a deed with a Totem, they have +1 influence. Noon, Boot: Boot a Totem you control to move one of your dudes to its location.

title: Morgan Stables
text: Reduce the cost of the first Horse you play each turn by 1 ghost rock. React, Boot: After you complete a Noon or Shootout ability that moved one of your dudes, draw a card and discard a card. Make another play or pass; if you are not in a shootout, that play cannot be actin’.

title: Xiang Fang
text: React: After Xiang enters play, gain ghost rock equal to the production at Xiang’s location. If it is a deed you do not own or your home, reduce that card’s production to 0 until after the next Upkeep phase.
flavor: "Well, at least they stopped using her as a hat rack." -He Fang

title: He Fang
text: Noon, Boot: Play a non-Gadget Abomination from your hand at this location, reducing its cost by 2.
flavor: "You never know where life will lead you. Death, at least, should take you home."

title: Kabeda Hakurei
text: Once per turn, Kabeda can use a Noon ability on an unbooted Totem in an adjacent location.
flavor: "When I first arrived, I was overwhelmed by the spiritual conflict and decay here. Then, I actually saw Gomorra."

title: Zachary Deloria
text: If you are a player, Zachary has a bullet bonus equal to the highest influence among your dudes at his location (including himself).
flavor: "Shaw some respect, man. Don't you know who this is?"

title: Karl Odett
text: While all of your dudes in play are Abominations, Karl has +3 influence.
flavor: "No chance of the inmates running this particular asylum." -Ivor Hawley

title: Erik Samson
text:
While Erik has a Mystical goods, he has +1 influence.
While Erik has a Melee Weapon, he is a stud.
flavor:
"Moses stood on the Red Sea shore,
He was battin' at the waves with a two-by-four.
Well if I could I surely would,
Stand on the rock where Moses stood."

title: Dr. Brian Foxworth
text: While Brian is unbooted and has no cards attached, he cannot be called out in the town square. React: Before taking casualties, discard Brian to reduce your casualties by Brian’s influence.
flavor: "If I'm acting like I'm not impressed, it's only because I'm not impressed. Now back up and let me work."

title: Buford Hurley
text: While Buford is at a Saloon or Casino, reduce his upkeep and the production of the deed by 1.
flavor: "Umm... I think you're in his seat." -Ulysses Marks

title: Doris Powell
text:
At the end of the turn, or if Doris is ever at home, she loses all control points.
Whenever Doris moves to an in-town deed without booting, she gains a control point, to a maximum of 3.
flavor: "That woman is everywhere. She's a true saint." -Abram Grothe

title: Rico Rodegain
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, look at your opponent’s hand. Place your non-Grifter dudes on top of your deck and return their cost to your stash. Search your deck for up to the same number of Dudes to add to your starting gang, following the standard setup rules.

title: Maza Gang Hideout
text:
This deed is not adjacent to the town square.
This deed has +1 production for each adjacent location.
flavor: "Maza... you ever feel like we're small fish in a really big pond?"

title: Miasmatic Purifier
text: At the start of Sundown (before victory is checked), the controller pulls. If the pull is a club, each dude here gets –1 influence until the end of the turn and does not unboot this Sundown, then discard this deed.

title: Disgenuine Currency Press
text:
After this Gadget is successfully invented, gain 5 ghost rock and unboot the Mad Scientist that invented it.
After this Gadget is discarded from play, its owner draws a card.
flavor: "You want to keep working here? Invent something that actually makes money!" -Lula Morgan

title: Tlaloc's Furies
text:
If there is an unbooted non-Melee Weapon in the opposing posse, this goods provides no bullet bonus.
This dude has +1 bullets and +1 to their skills for each Tlaloc’s Furies you control.
flavor: "The spirits were clear: Whateley gets these or we all die." -Three-Eyed Hawk

title: Jael's Guile
text: Cheatin’ Resolution, Boot: If your hand is illegal, you must boot this dude to use this ability. Your opponent boots or discards a dude in their posse, then boots or discards a dude in their posse. Non-wanted dudes cannot be chosen if there are wanted dudes that can be chosen.

title: Personal Ornithopter
text: Repeat Shootout, pay 1 ghost rock: This dude joins your posse (moving if necessary). Shootout, Boot: Send this dude home booted.
flavor: "Wheeeeeeeeeee!" -Zoe Halbrook

title: Hustled
text: Noon: Boot your Grifter and increase their bounty by 1 to gain 2 ghost rock. Boot an opposing card in the Grifter’s location.
flavor: "Well, you're not lucky, and you aren't skilled. But you are very generous." -Gina Tailfeathers

title: An Accidental Reunion
text: Shootout: Each time a player reveals an illegal draw hand, that player takes two extra casualties that round. You may pay 2 ghost rock to place this card back into your hand.
flavor: "I came for Sloane... Who are you?" -Mario Crane

title: A Slight Modification
text: React: After an opponent declares the use of a Shootout or non-Cheatin’ Resolution ability, boot a Gadget on a dude in your posse. Waive all costs of the ability, and that ability has no effect.

title: Rabbit Takes Revenge
keywords: Technique • Tao of the Jade Rabbit
text: Shootout Tao Technique: Choose an opposing dude. Make that dude a draw and this dude a stud. Those dudes cannot leave this shootout. If played as a combo, the opposing dude boots all their attached cards and must be chosen as the first casualty this round.

title: Shizeng Lu
text: While your stash has less ghost rock than each other player and another player owns this location, Shizeng Lu is worth +1 control point, and this location has -2 control points and does not unboot during the Sundown phase.

title: Forster Cooke
text: While Forster is at a Saloon or Casino, your other dudes have +1 bullets and +1 value.
flavor: "I hear more confessions than a priest. Those kinds of secrets can come in handy."

title: Joseph Dusty Hill
text:
While Joseph has a Spirit, he has +1 influence.
While Joseph has an Attire, he has +1 bullets and +2 Shaman skill.
flavor: "He's lookin' sharp and lookin' for trouble." -Richard Faulkner

title: Mariel Lewis
text: Shootout: If your posses has higher total influence than the opposing posse, remove a dude from the opposing posse and send them home without booting.
flavor: "Tondzaosha's body wasn't even cold when they spat on his memory. I'm a Warden now, because I won't be Shoshone."

title: The Tattooed Man
text:
Whenever an ability discards a Hex on The Tattooed Man, you may place it into your hand instead.
Whenever an ability aces a Hex on The Tattooed Man, you may place it into your discard pile instead.
flavor: "Long before you knew me, you were wishing me on someone else."

title: Riorden O'Lithen
text: Noon: Boot a spell on Riorden to give a dude at this or an adjacent location 1 bounty. Discard the spell if the dude was not wanted when you used this ability.
flavor: "Let this wicked town not drag you into sin! Judgment awaits the quick and the dead!"

title: "Lucky" Sky Borne
text: You may include a Sidekick goods in your starting posse as if it were a dude, and attach it to Sky at the start of the game. If it's a Gadget, shuffle your deck, and Sky invents it as normal.
flavor: "Magnificient specimens, aren't they, Martin?"

title: Miranda Clarke
text:
While Miranda has a control point, she has +2 influence.
While Miranda has at least 2 bounty, she has +2 bullets.
flavor: "What can I say? A gal just needs to feel wanted."

title: Elliot Smithson
text: React: After Elliot Smithson goes home booted following a successful job initiated by a dude's ability or an action card, unboot the leader and gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Makin' the money's almost as fun as spending it!"

title: Shelby Hunt
text: Shootout: If a dude in the opposing posse has higher bullets than Shelby, Shelby gains +1 bullets, is a stud, and cannot be affected by other players' Shootout abilities.
flavor: "I thought everything was bigger in Texas... until I saw my first Maze Dragon."

title: The Joker's Smile
text: Whenever a joker is aced during lowball, the controller gains 1 ghost rock. Controller Noon, Boot: Discard a joker to gain 1 ghost rock and draw a card. Controller Noon, Boot: Pay 1 ghost rock to move a joker from your Boot Hill to your discard pile.

title: Old Marge's Manor
text: The controller can use ghost rock on this deed to pay for action cards or gadget abilities during shootouts. React, Boot: Before making a play, move all ghost rock counters (not bounty) from a card you control to this deed. Noon, Boot: Place 1 ghost rock on this deed.

title: Xemo's Turban
text: Repeat Noon, Boot: Pull. If the pull is not a club, you may pay 1 ghost rock to draw a card, discard a card, and unboot Xemo's Turban.
flavor: A relic from the past may reveal the future.

title: Blight Serum
text: While this card is attached to a deed, after a dude moves here, move that dude home booted and ace this card. Noon, Boot: Attach this card to this deed.
flavor: "All smell is disease." -Sir Edwin Chadwick

title: Guide Horse
text: Noon, Boot: Move this dude to the town square.
flavor: "The horses know the route. If I could just train them to drag their riders out of saloons, we'd be all set." -Jon Longstride

title: Marty
text: Can only attach to a Mad Scientist. This dude has +1 Mad Scientist skill. React, Boot: After this dude boots to invent a gadget, unboot him.
flavor: "Yes, Dr. Borne. Whatever you say, Dr. Borne."

title: Righteous Fury
text: Shootout Miracle 8, Boot: If you win this round, your opponent suffers two additional casualties. Shootout Miracle 12, Boot: Your opponent suffers two additional casualties this round. Ace this card.

title: Owl's Insight
text: Cheatin' Resolution Spirit 5, Boot: Attach any number of goods or spells from your play hand (as shoppin') reducing the cost of each by 1. Draw cards until your hand is at its maximum size.

title: Outgunned
text: Resolution: If your posse has a higher total bullet rating than the opposing posse, boot your shooter to increase your hand rank by two.
flavor: "Peace through superior firepower." -Elander Boldman

title: Martyr's Cry
text: Resolution: Discard a Miracle from a dude in your posse to reduce your casualties by three. If your opponent has an illegal draw hand, reduce your casualties by five instead.

title: Deliberate Infection
text: This dude has has +1 upkeep and -1 influence. Cheatin' Resolution: The cheatin' player attaches this card to one of their dudes. Send that dude home booted. If this a shootout, you choose the dude.
flavor: "Here, Lillian dear... use my handkierchief." -Lula Morgan

title: Sophie Lacoste
text: Repeat Noon: Pay 1 ghost rock. If Sophie is in a Public location, one of your other dudes at this loction gains +1 influence.
flavor: "You know how to catch someone's eye? Tell them to look away."

title: "Crazy" Mike Draksil
text: When Mike calls out a dude with lower influence, the mark's controller must discard a card as an additional cost to refuse the call out.
flavor: "He's loyal, but the chip on his shoulder make him a bit top-heavy." -Chief Stephen Seven-Eagles

title: Horace Manse
text: React: After Horace enters play, take an Abomination from your Boot Hill into your play hand and discard a card.
flavor: "Try to rest, friend. It will all be over soon."

title: Jia Mein (Exp.1)
text: Noon: Play a Condition Noon action, reducing its cost by 2, to make Jia a stud. Noon: Boot a spell on Jia and pay 1 ghost rock to take a Condition from your discard pile into your hand.

title: Janosz Pratt
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose a Gadget Weapon in your discard pile. Janosz invents that card without booting, reducing its cost by 2. If successful, attach it to any of your dudes in the shootout. Discard it at the end of the turn.

title: Vasilis the Boar
text: While Vasilis is in a shootout, each wanted dude in the opposing posse has -2 value. Shootout: Use the Shootout ability of a Weapon on Vasilis (even if that ability has already been used), ignoring any boot cost, then ace that Weapon.
flavor: "Guess they don't make guns like they used to."

title: Luke, the Errand Boy
text: Noon/Shootout: Move a Gadget from your dude in this or an adjacent location to another one of your dudes in this or an adjacent location.

title: Arnold Stewart
text: Noon: Boot a Gadget on Arnold to discard the top five cards of your deck. If one of those cards was an Out of Town deed, you may boot Arnold to place the deed into your hand.
flavor: "No prospect too big or too small."

title: Rick Henderson
text: React, Boot: After a dude goes home booted from this shootout, their owner must give you 1 ghost rock or discard them.
flavor: "That's right, everything in the wallet. And I'll take that stash in yer boot too!"

title: Willa Mae MacGowan
text: Resolution: Ace Willa to send all other dudes in your posse home booted.
flavor: "That's enough, Esther! I will not listen to any more of your childish stories about cookie-stealing goblins!"

title: The Orphanage
text: Controller Noon, Boot: All deeds with 2 or more control points have -1 control point and +2 production until after the next Upkeep phase.

title: The Place
text: Increase the production of the leftmost deed in each other street by 2.
flavor: "If you need to ask what it's called, chances are you can't afford it." -Lula Morgan

title: Hawley's Rose
text:
This dude gains the Abomination keyword.
During Sundown, this dude has +1 influence, and +1 additional influence if there's an opposing dude at this deed.
flavor: "So rare... but delightfully useful." -Ivor Hawley

title: LeMat Revolver
text: Cheatin' Resolution, Boot: Increase your hand rank by this dude's bullet rating. Resolution, Boot: Only use this ability if this dude is a stud. If, by including the top card of your discard pile with your draw hand, you have three pairs (of different values), increase your hand rank by this dude's bullet rating.

title: Yagn's Mechanical Skeleton
text:
This dude gains the Gadget keyword and has +3 value.
Opposing cards cannot boot or move this dude.

title: Fool's Gold
text: React Hex 5, Boot: Use after all players ante for lowball, if this dude is in the town square. If successful, move 1 ghost rock from the pot into your stash and increase this dude's bounty by 1.
flavor: "You can't lose what you don't put on the table."

title: Mother Bear's Rage
text: Noon Spirit 5, Boot: A 2-stud Nature Spirit comes into play at this location or an adjacent deed and calls out a dude there.
flavor: "It seems a sound thrashing is the only way anyone learns anything around here." -Kabeda Hakurei

title: Focusing Chi
text: If revealed for a Technique pull, you may unboot this dude, look at the top three cards of your deck, and discard any of them. Return the rest to your deck in the same order. Noon/Shootout Technique: Place this card on top of your deck, or draw a card.

title: Mugging
text: Noon Job: Mark an opposing dude. Boot up to two cards attached to the mark. If the job succeeds, send the mark home booted, and you may ace up to two booted cards attached to the mark.

title: Signing Over the Stores
text: Noon Job: Mark the town square. If successful, discard up to five cards from the top of your deck, then attach up to three different goods cards from your discard pile to your dudes (as shoppin'), reducing their cost by 2 each. If this job was unopposed, unboot your leader.

title: No Funny Stuff
text: Shootout: Shootout, React, and non-Cheatin' Resolution abilities cannot be used during this shootout. As a Shootout play, any player may discard two random cards from their hand to end this effect.

title: Carlton "Min" Rutherford
text: Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: If you have less ghost rock in your stash than each other player, unboot Carlton.
flavor: "I learned more in one day with Master Fu than in all my time at Oxford."

title: Lucretia Fanzini
text: While in the town square during an in-town shootout, Lucretia may use abilities on her Hymns as if she were in your posse.
flavor: "If she ever sang a dirge, folks'd be lining up to die." -T'ou Chi Chow

title: Rhonda Sageblossom
text:
Rhonda's Horse has the Sidekick keyword.
Whenever you discard a Sidekick from Rhonda to cover casualties, you may return it to your hand instead.

title: Francisco Rosales
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark the Town Square. If successful, search your discard pile for a Sidekick or Horse and attach it to one of your dudes, reducing its cost by 2.
flavor: "No one knows why critters like him so much. Must just have one of those faces." -Laughing Crow

title: Ambrose Douglas
text: Noon: Discard a card to give Ambrose +1 influence. If you discarded a spell or Mystical goods, you may unboot your outfit and its ability may be used an additional time.
flavor: "For this sort of transaction, I don't take... money."

title: Constance Daughtry
text: During High Noon, Constance has +1 influence while at a Government deed. React: After you resolve an ability printed on your outfit, unboot Constance.
flavor: "Why, oh why, could't I have found a quiet little library to run?"

title: Tallulah "Lula" Morgan (Exp.1)
text: If your outfit is , Lula has -1 upkeep per control point you have. Whenever you gain ghost rock from an ability during High Noon, gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Ah told ya this company'd be mine. Now, what to do next..."

title: Darragh Mèng
text: After Darragh successfully casts a spell and the spell is still in play, discard the spell.
flavor: "The card tables in Gomorra have truly become an assembly of the strange lately." -Steele Archer

title: Ol' Howard
text: A deed with this card attached has 0 production and 0 control points, which cannot be modified. React: At the start of the game, search your deck for a deed and play it, paying all costs. Ol' Howard attaches to that deed, and permanently becomes a Condition and not a dude.
flavor: "YOU CAN HAVE NOTHING!"

title: Theo Whateley-Boyer
text: React, Pay 1 Ghost Rock: When you discard a lowball hand containing a joker, attach the joker to Theo (do not ace it). Resolution: Boot a Hex on Theo to discard a card from your draw hand and replace it with an attached joker.
flavor: "We need you, Nic. Your family needs you."

title: "Mahogany" Jackson
text: Whenever Mahogany joins a posse, discard the top two cards of your deck.
flavor: She's a one woman wrecking crew... and Gomorra ain't gonna know what hit it!

title: Travis Moone (Exp.1)
text: React, Boot: After an opponent draws a card (into their play hand) from a card effect, draw two cards.
flavor: "And here y'all thought I was a one-trick pony. But I've always known... I'm the real deal."

title: Henry Moran
text: If Henry is unbooted when you would reveal an illegal draw hand during lowball, boot Henry, discard the illegal hand, and reveal the top five cards of your deck as your hand instead.
flavor: "He makes Bob Bidwell look like the luckiest duck there ever was." -Xiong "Wendy" Cheng

title: Gomorra Lot Commission
text: You may start this deed in play in place of a dude. Controller Noon, Boot: Discard a deed from your hand to gain 1 ghost rock. You may move one of your dudes to a deed with a name that matches the discarded deed.

title: Wagner Memorial Ranch
text: You may start this deed in play in place of one dude. Controller React, Boot: Before your dude makes an invention skill test at this deed, reduce its difficulty by 2. If successful, unboot the dude. If the invented Gadget was a Horse or Improvement, this deed gains +1 production permanently.

title: Notary Public
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Boot a Government or Public deed that you own or control on this street. If you booted a Government deed, give a dude 1 bounty. If you booted a Public deed, you may move one of your dudes (without booting).

title: Market Street
text: While this deed is unbooted, increase the difficulty of skill tests made at this or adjacent locations by 1. Controller Noon: Boot this deed.

title: Companhurst's
text: You may start this deed in place of one dude. While you are tied for the lowest ghost rock, you are considered to have less ghost rock than all other players.

title: Epidemic Laboratory
text: Controller Noon Job, Boot: Your skilled dude leads a job marking this deed. If successful, this deed gains +1 control point and +1 production permanently.
flavor: "There are no such things as applied sciences, only applications of science." -Louis Pasteur, Revue Scientifique, 1871

title: Walters Creek Distillery
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Boot a Saloon or Casino that you own or control on this street. If you booted a Casino gain 2 ghost rock. If you booted a Saloon, you may discard a card to draw a card.
flavor: "That's the real fuel that runs this town." -Clementine Lepp

title: Silent Sigil
text: The number of cards you can discard at Sundown is reduced by one. Controller React: After you refill your hand during Sundown, draw a card.

title: Auto-Gatling
text:
After this is invented, attach it to your home or to a deed you control.
This card's owner has a +2 stud bullet bonus during shootouts at this location. Unbooted dudes not controlled by this card's owner get -1 influence while at this location.

title: Sunday Best
text: This dude has +3 Influence during the Upkeep phase. React, Boot: At the start of the Upkeep Phase, move this dude to an adjacent location (without booting).
flavor: "Well ain't you just precious!"

title: Tusk
text:
After this card enters play, draw a card.
This dude has +5 value for opposing card effects.
flavor: "You can kill with any old thing. A weapon like that just does it with class." -Shelby Hunt

title: Mountain Lion Friend
text: Your posse has a +1 draw bonus while this dude is in a shootout. React: Before you take casualties, if this dude is in your posse, ace this card to reduce your casualties by two.
flavor: "The heart of a wild beast is the same as a tame one It's the claws you have to watch out for." -Three-Eyes Hawk

title: Spirit Steed
text: Can only attach to a shaman. Noon, Boot: Move this dude to a location of a Spirit (without booting). Noon, Repeat: Boot a Spirit on this dude to move them to another location.

title: Crafty Hare
text: Shootout Spirit X, Boot: X is the highest value among opposing dudes in this shootout. This shaman leaves the shootout and moves to another location. If this shaman was the mark of a job, the job automatically fails after the shootout ends.

title: Onward Christian Soldiers
text: Shootout Miracle 4, Boot: All dudes in your posse get +1 bullets, and cannot have their bullets reduced or changed to a draw by other player's card effects.
flavor: "We're marching as to war!" -Abram Grothe

title: Turtle's Guard
text: Resolution Spirit 4, Boot: All dudes in your posse gain the Harrowed keyword until the end of this round. If your opponent has an illegal draw hand, a 2-stud Harrowed Nature Spirit enters play and joins your posse, and gains the Harrowed keyword.

title: Sight Beyond Sight
text: Noon Hex 7, Boot: Look at one or two random cards in an opponent's hand. You may ace this card to ace a non-unique card you looked at.
flavor: "Doctor... Hawley is behing it all... and it's far worse than we thought." -Lillian Morgan

title: Requiem for a Good Boy
text: Resolution: Discard a Sidekick in your posse to reduce your casualties this round by two. Unboot the Sidekick's dude. Send an opposing dude home booted.
flavor: "Nooooo!!!" -Lucy Clover

title: Fool Me Once...
text: While attached to your home, each other player draws a card whenever you reveal an illegal draw hand. Cheatin' Resolution: Attach this card to the cheatin' player's home and draw three cards.

title: Fiddle Game
text: While this card is attached to your home, it has +2 production. Discard this card from your home after a Cheatin' Resolution ability is used against you. Noon, Job: Mark your home. If successful, attach this card to your home.

title: Pigging Out
text: Shootout Technique: Discard the top five cards of your deck. Search your discard pile for a Tao of the Zhu Bajie and add it to your hand. Whenever this dude uses a Technique that reduces an opposing dude's bullets, influence, or value, reduce it by an additional 1.

title: Technological Exhibition
text: Noon Job: Your Mad Scientist leads a job that marks an in-town location. If successful, choose a Gadget in your hand or discard pile. Your leader invents it without booting, reducing its difficulty and cost by 5. If you marked the town square, the gadget permanently gets 1 control point.

title: A Piece of the Action
text: Noon: Play a dude from your hand, reducing their cost by 4, to a minimum of 4; the cost cannot be reduced further. You may search your discard pile for a non-Gadget goods and attach it to that dude, reducing its cost by the amount this card reduced the dude's cost.

title: Framed
text: Noon: Choose an opposing dude and pay ghost rock equal to their influence. That dude's controller either boots them and pays you 1 ghost rock, or gives that dude 1 bounty. Noon: Give an opposing wanted dude 3 bounty.
flavor: "But I'm innocent!" -Max Baine

title: Plague of Grasshoppers
text: Noon: Choose one or more of your unbooted Kung Fu dudes and select a location. Each chosen dude performs a Kung Fu test. Each dude that succeeds moves to that location (without booting).

title: Foreboding Glance
text: Noon: Choose your dude and an opposing dude in the same location. If your dude has more control points, boot all cards attached to the opposing dude. If your dude has more influence, boot the opposing dude. If your dude has more bounty, call out the opposing dude.
flavor: "Small town, Hawley. I'm sure we'll bump into each other again." -Nicodemus Whateley

title: Heretic Joker (Red)
text: This card is only used for draw hands and pulls. You choose its suit and value. While this card is in your draw hand, your hand cannot be illegal. Decrease your hand rank by three. (Do not ace this card after use).

title: Heretic Joker (Black)
text: This card is only used for draw hands and pulls. You choose its suit and value. While this card is in your draw hand, your hand cannot be illegal. Decrease your hand rank by three. (Do not ace this card after use).

title: Caitlin McCue
text: While Caitlin is at a Public location, your dudes are considered to have 1 less bounty. While Caitlin is at a Government deed, your Public deeds have +1 production.
flavor: "I don't think anybody needs to serve these particular warrants..."

title: Bethany Shiile
text: Each of your dudes with an Attire has +1 influence, +1 bullets, and +1 value during High Noon.
flavor: "Did you really think looking this good was a one-man job?" -Joseph "Dusty" Hill

title: Tyxarglenak (Exp.1)
text: While Tyxarglenak is unbooted and has a Mystical goods, he has +2 bullets and all opposing Shootout actions must choose him if possible.
flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger gun." -Drew Beauman

title: Dr. Dayl Burnett
text: Noon: Remove 1 bounty from an opposing dude to invent a Gadget without booting, reducing the difficulty of the Gadget by 3.
flavor: "If these algorithms hold, I can invent a machine capable of predicting crime before it happens! Brilliant!"

title: Maggie Harris
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark your home. If successful, search your discard pile for a Horse and attach it to any one of your dudes, reducing its cost by 1.
flavor: "That's a woman after my own heart." -Jarrett Blake

title: Emilia Vivirias
text: While Emilia is in a shootout, she gets a bonus to her bullets and Huckster skill equal to the number of Hexes she has attached. This bonus cannot exceed +4.
flavor: "If you can see the gold flecks in her eyes, it's 'cause she just took it all from ya." -Old Man McDroste

title: "Professor" Duncan
text: Duncan has +3 Shaman skill when casting Totems.
flavor: "I think the only time that fellow's been to university was to rummage through its garbage." -Carlton Rutherford

title: The Highbinder Hotel
text: Controller Shootout, Boot: Send your dude home booted.
flavor: "Sure, there may be wanted men here. The Queen of England may be here, too, but do you see me servin' tea?" -Harry Highbinder

title: 2nd Bank Of Gomorra
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Place 2 ghost rock (from the bank) onto this deed. Controller Noon, Boot: Move all ghost rock from this deed to your stash.
flavor: "Now we got two banks to rob!" -Marion Seville

title: High Stakes Haven
keywords: Private • Casino • Strike • Out of Town
text: Whenever the controller reveals an illegal draw hand, that player either pays 1 ghost rock or discards a random card.

title: Culpability Scientizer
text: After this is invented, give a dude 2 bounty. Noon: Discard this card to call out a wanted dude at this location. If this results in a shootout, make a shootout play before the Winner makes the first play.

title: Espuelas
text: While this dude has a Horse, they have +1 Influence. Noon, Boot: If this dude has a Horse, move them to an adjacent location.

title: Rites of the Smoking Mirror
text: Noon: Ace this card to attach a Mystical goods to this dude (as Shoppin’), reducing its cost by 4. The goods enters play booted. Noon/Shootout: Discard this card to unboot a dude with a Mystical goods at this location.

title: Essence of Armitage
text: Can only be attached to Abominations. While this dude is in a shootout, non-Abomination dudes in the shootout have -1 bullets. React, Boot: After an opposing dude flees this shootout, this dude permanently gains 1 control point.
flavor: "Little guy wants out, doesn't he? He really hates it when I shake it like this..." -Ambrose Douglas

title: Festering Grasp
text: You may not cast this spell if there is an unbooted non-Melee Weapon in the opposing posse. Shootout Hex 13, Boot: Reduce an opposing dude’s value by 6. If this would reduce their value below 1, ace them, then search your discard pile for a Sidekick and attach it to this dude, reducing its cost by 2.

title: Silver Pheasant's Bounty
text: Attaches only to deeds. This deed has +1 production. Noon Spirit 6, Boot: Boot this deed to gain 2 ghost rock.
flavor: "A wealthy little spirit borrowed from across the sea. Makes all sorts of ventures thrive." -Laughing Crow

title: Comin' Up Roses
text: Resolution: Choose a card in your draw hand with no duplicate value in that hand. Change that card to the suit of your choice. Cheatin’ Resolution: Change one or two cards in your draw hand to the suit and value of your choice. Their new values cannot match another value in that hand. For the rest of the shootout, while your hand contains a legal flush or straight, you have +2 hand rank.
flavor: "Pretty red faces all in a row. Beat these!" -Steele Archer

title: Run Rabbit Run
text: Shootout Technique: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. Search your discard pile for a Tao of the Jade Rabbit and add it to your hand. Whenever this dude moves during this shootout, they gain +1 bullets until the end of the shootout.

title: Putting The Pieces Together
text: Boot this card whenever you reveal an illegal draw hand. While this card is unbooted, increase your shootout hand rank by 1; if not, decrease it by 1. Noon: Attach this card to your home, booted.
flavor: "I know things about Hawley... horrible things." -Valeria Batten

title: Someone Else's Problem
text: React: After you mark a location for a job, choose an opposing dude. That dude cannot join the mark’s posse and is not affected by the job effects.
flavor:
"That circus fella's been doin' something wrong with the sick all this time!" -Ulysses Marks
"So? The plague is Gomorra's problem, not ours." -Jonah Essex

title: Lost to the Plague
text: This dude can only move to adjacent locations and home, and cannot boot to pay the cost of abilities. Increase this dude’s upkeep by 1 for each other Condition they have. Noon: Attach to any dude with value 6 or lower.

title: El Armadillo De Hierro
text: While in a shootout, El Armadillo has +1 bullets for each Technique successfully performed at his location during the shootout, or that moved him into a posse.
flavor: "¡Viva el pueblo de Gomorra!"

title: Jim Hexter
text: Shootout: Pay 1 ghost rock to the controller of the opposing posse’s leader or mark to make Jim a stud.
flavor: "He's a master burglar like you've never seen. Of course, with all the bribe money he paid out, I think Morgan just about broke even." -T'ou Chi Chow

title: The Mixer
text: Shootout: Choose a dude. For the duration of this shootout, that dude ignores all bullet modifiers except from attached goods.
flavor: "This should work... but I'd stand back if I were you."

title: Hupirika Sue
text: React: After your dude moves to a deed using a Noon Spirit ability, the dude may immediately call out an opposing dude at their new location. Your dude has +2 bullets for the duration of the shootout.

title: The Harvester
text: In a starting posse, The Harvester counts as three dudes. The Harvester cannot enter play through the use of a Shoppin’ play. The Harvester can only move to adjacent locations or home.
flavor: "Ivor says we can let him out... as long as we're careful." -Kevin Wainwright

title: Lucy Clover (Exp.1)
text: Repeat React: After both posses are formed for a shootout, if the opposing posse contains 2 or more bounty, Lucy becomes a stud until the end of the shootout.
flavor: "We got bigger problems than bounties today, Sloane!"

title: Buckin' Billy Ballard
text: While Billy has a Horse attached, he has +1 bullets and +1 influence. Noon/Shootout: Boot Billy’s Horse to draw a card. You may boot a dude at this location.

title: Antoine Peterson
text: React: After Antoine enters play, search your discard pile for an action card that starts a job and put it into your hand. Discard a card. You may unboot your dude at home and give them 2 bounty.

title: Denise Brancini
text:
Denise cannot be in a starting posse.
Denise has +X bullets and +X upkeep, where X is equal to the number of jokers in all boot hills.
If Denise is discarded during upkeep, all other players may shuffle all jokers from their boot hill into their deck.
flavor: "There are no rules anymore!"

title: Long Strides Ranch
text: While you have at least two Horses, this deed has +2 production. Controller Noon, Boot: Attach a Horse from your hand to your dude (as Shoppin’), reducing its cost by 2.
flavor: "Hay is for scrawny city horses. Give me a grass-fed mustang any ol' day." -Jon Longstride

title: The Gomorra Gazette
text: Controller React, Boot: After an opposing dude’s bounty increases, gain ghost rock equal to their influence.
flavor: "Explosions ripped through the town, destroying buildings and revealing a network of tunnels underneath. But what was hidden in those tunnels was much worse." -Alexis Mirges, Ace Reporter

title: "Open Wound"
text: This deed is adjacent to all other Open Wounds. Repeat Controller Noon: Pay 1 ghost rock to move one of your dudes from this location to an adjacent location.
flavor: "Shall we show the folks our collection?" -Ivor Hawley

title: Doomsday Supply
text: Attach this to your home. Noon/Shootout, Boot: Discard this card. Search your discard pile for a goods and attach it to one of your dudes, reducing its cost by 2. If this card is played as a shootout play, that dude must be in your posse.
flavor: "Folks around here have told me it pays to stock up for a rainy day." -Richard Faulkner

title: Bacillus Pasteuria
text: You may boot your Mad Scientist instead of paying this card’s cost. Noon: Discard this card to choose a dude at this location. Unboot that dude. You may discard a condition attached to that dude.
flavor: "It's not a cure! It's a counter-pathogen!" -Louis Pasteur

title: The Blighted
text:
Attaches only to Abominations.
After an opposing dude is aced or discarded from play without being a casualty, you may pay 1 ghost rock to take this card from your discard pile and attach it to any one of your dudes, paying all costs. Only one Blighted may be played in this way per opposing dude aced or discarded.

title: Sun-Touched Raven
text: Shootout Spirit 6, Boot: Look at the top five cards of your deck. You may discard up to three of them. You may boot this Shaman to draw a card.
flavor: "Try not to be so distracted by shiny things this time, okay?" -Three-Eyed Hawk

title: Inner Struggle
text: While this card is booted, reduce your shootout hand rank by 1. If you reveal an illegal draw hand and the owner of this card has a legal hand, boot this card. Cheatin’ Resolution: Attach this card to the cheatin’ player’s home, booted. That player discards one random card from their play hand.
flavor:
"After all this, why now?!" -Lucy Clover
"I'm... not ... doing... it!" -Sloane

title: Serendipitous Arrival
text: Shootout: Play a dude from your hand into your posse, reducing their cost by 5. When the shootout ends, pay 3 ghost rock or discard that dude.

title: Siege Of The Orphanage
text: Shootout: All dudes controlled by the owner of this location are studs. Those dudes cannot flee the shootout. For the remainder of the shootout, the owner of this location suffers one less casualty each round.

title: Lighting The Fuse
text: Cheatin’ Resolution: Return a deed owned by the cheatin’ player to their hand. If played during lowball, the cheatin’ player may instead boot two of their dudes, moving them to that deed (if they are not already there).
flavor: "Did you think me idle, just waiting for you to put the pieces together?" -Ivor Hawley

title: One Fights As Many
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark the town square and ace this card. If successful, each Kung Fu dude in your posse makes a technique check, adding 4 to the pull. Each dude who succeeds permanently gets 1 control point.

title: Shi Long Peng
text: Shi Long can use Techniques as if he had Kung Fu equal to his Blessed skill.
flavor: "A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live." -Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching

title: Seamus McCaffrey
text: While you have dudes in five or more different locations, reduce other players’ control point totals by 2.
flavor: "I see the people's struggle for liberation involved you taking your shirt off... again." -Abuelita Espinoza

title: Gene North Star
text: Shootout: Discard a Spirit attached to Gene to give him +2 bullets.
flavor: "You can 'din boo, sui boo' all you want. I'm still gonna kick your tail."

title: Speaks-With-Earth
text: React, Boot: After an opposing dude moves to this location, boot that dude. You may unboot a Totem at this location, and its abilities may be used an additional time this turn.
flavor: "You wanna ask questions or you wanna save lives? Get moving!"

title: Quimby R. Tuttlemeir
text: Noon: Ace an Abomination with 1 or more influence that you own and control at this or an adjacent location. Quimby permanently gains 1 influence.
flavor: "I do so adore the frontier... so many unique flavor profiles."

title: Erin Knight
text: Repeat Shootout: Boot one of your Deputies to have them join Erin’s posse (moving if necessary).
flavor: "It were better that a millstone be hanged about his neck and cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones." -Luke 17:2

title: Nicholas Kramer
text: Nicholas has a bullet bonus equal to the number of Gadgets you control. This bonus cannot exceed +4.
flavor: "He's got a real passion for bein' prepared in every possible circumstance... and then some." -Elander Boldman

title: Pancho Castillo (Exp.1)
text: React: When Pancho enters play, move 1 bounty from each of your Wanted dudes to Pancho. Shootout: Choose a dude with value equal to or lower than Pancho’s bounty. Send that dude home booted.
flavor: "I don't like to be told what to think, Jonah... even if you're telling me I should only do it about myself."

title: The Grey Man
text: Noon: Choose a dude at this location whose value is equal to or lower than The Grey Man’s bullets. Send that dude home booted.
flavor: "Don't fear the things that go bump in the night. The silent ones are much more dangerous." -Valeria Batten

title: J.W. Byrne, P. I.
text: Controller React, Boot: After drawing your lowball hand, but before revealing it, boot one of your Grifters at this location. Discard and redraw up to two cards from your lowball hand.
flavor: In Gomorra, nothing stays buried forever...

title: Grimoires & More
text: Controller React, Boot: After your Huckster enters play, pull. If the pull is a club, send that dude home booted; otherwise, attach a Hex from your discard pile to that dude, paying all costs.

title: Knight's Chasuble
text: This dude’s value cannot be reduced. Conditions cannot be attached to this dude. React, Boot: After this dude is booted by an opposing ability, unboot them.

title: Pedro
text:
This dude has -3 value.
This dude cannot be moved by opposing card effects.
flavor: "I'm surprised he moves fast enough to catch the grass." -Jon Longstride

title: Aetheric Shockwave Inducer
text: Whenever this dude is declared as your shooter, pull. If the pull is a club, this card only provides +1 bullets this round (instead of +4).
flavor: "Well, it would take a scientist to explain. Just watch." -Elander Boldman

title: The Gambler's Gun
text: After a Cheatin’ Resolution is used against you, discard this dude. Resolution, Boot: If this dude is your shooter, increase your hand rank by 2.
flavor: "Heck with holdin' and foldin'. Sometimes you just gotta shoot 'em." -Travis Moone

title: Get Behind Me, Satan!
text: Resolution Miracle 5, Boot: Reduce your casualties this round by this dude’s Blessed rating. Choose an opposing Abomination dude, who provides nothing to the posse’s stud and draw ratings during the next round of the shootout.

title: Ghostly Communion
text: Noon Spirit 5, Boot: Move this dude to a Holy Ground location or to a location adjacent to one. Shootout Spirit 7, Boot: This dude joins your posse at a Holy Ground location or a location adjacent to one. This dude becomes a stud.

title: Calling The Cavalry
text: Shootout: During this round’s resolution, both players gain +1 hand rank for each Horse in their posse. One dude in your posse becomes a stud until the end of the shootout.
flavor: "You want this world? You'll have to go through us!" -Sarah Meoquanee

title: Rite Of Profane Abstersion
text: Shootout: Boot or discard a spell or Mystical goods from a dude in your posse. Send all A-value dudes and 0-bullet dudes home booted. Return all Sidekicks in this shootout to their owner’s hand.
flavor: "Whatever blasphemy you're commitin', commit it faster!" -Nathan Shane

title: Showboating
text: If you pull this card for a skill test, you may immediately use its ability. React: After one of your dudes successfully invents an Experimental Gadget, or succeeds with any other skill test by 5 or more, they permanently gain 1 control point.

title: All Or Nothing
text: Noon Job: Mark a location. Dudes at that location can join the defending posse without permission from the mark. If successful, discard all cards attached to the location. If it’s a deed or the town square, discard all wanted and Abomination dudes at the location, and send the rest home booted.
flavor: "The time for talk is over!" -Abram Grothe

title: 108 Drunken Masters
text: Deeds at the ends of each street have the Saloon Keyword. React, Boot: After you reveal a pull for a Technique, reduce the pull by the amount of Saloons you control. If you succeed by 5 or more, you may add the pulled card to your hand.

title: Gateway To Beyond
text: Noon, Boot: Choose a number of your Spirits up to the number of Holy Grounds you control. Unboot them. You can use their abilities an additional time this turn.

title: Full Moon Brotherhood
text: Noon, Boot: Choose an opposing non-token dude that is adjacent to one of your dudes. That dude loses all traits, cannot move via card effects, and cannot refuse callouts. If that dude leaves play, either draw two cards or gain 2 ghost rock.

title: Justice In Exile
text: Whenever an opposing player reveals an illegal hand, they must raise the bounty on one of their dudes by 1. If your hand is legal, you choose the dude. React,Boot: After an opposing wanted dude at the location of one of your Deputies leaves play during High Noon, gain 2 ghost rock. If they were discarded, you may ace them instead.

title: Morgan Regulators
text: When checking for victory, if there has not been a shootout this turn, each player's influence total at each location is limited to 5. Noon, Boot: Choose your dude. Move them to the town square. That dude becomes a stud. If they have a Horse, unboot them.

title: Protection Racket
text: Noon, Boot: Boot your dude at a deed to gain ghost rock equal to the number of deeds you control but do not own. If your opponents own fewer than three deeds total, gain 2 ghost rock. If you control at least three deeds you do not own, that dude gains a permanent control point and 1 bounty.

title: Zuì Waidan
text: Shootout: Boot your Saloon to give your dude +2 Kung Fu.
flavor: "No, it ain't the forbidden elixir of eternal life. But it'll get you full as a tick!"

title: Mr. Outang
text: Each of your Kung Fu dudes at this location with a Whiskey Flask or Baijiu Jar attached has +1 Kung Fu and is a stud.
flavor: "That monkey's drunk half this town under the table. S'good thing I don't make drinkin' a competition." -Ulysses Marks

title: Stevie Lyndon
text: While casting Hymns, Stevie has +4 Blessed skill.
flavor: "Some say I musta sold my soul for musical talent. Perhaps they're right, but every day, I pay the good Lord some interest on that investment."

title: Wei Xu
text: While in a shootout, Wei Xu has +2 influence and +5 value.
flavor: "I appreciate the Spiritual Society sending me a bodyguard. But I'm not sure picking fights with every person who looks my way is helping my reputation." -Chief Stephen Seven-Eagles

title: Eva Bright Eyes
text: Eva can only cast Totem and Sidekick Spirits. Shootout: Boot Eva's Horse to send her home booted.
flavor: "The tribe took care of me when no one would. But I've got to make my own path now and the Wardens are the best way to do that."

title: Mick Aduladi
text: While at a Holy Ground location, Mick is a stud. Noon: Move Mick to a Holy Ground location.
flavor: "How dare you defile this place!"

title: Absalom Hotchkiss
text: React: After Absalom moves to the location of an Abomination, move one of your other dudes to his location.
flavor: "There is strong game here. The others will be pleased."

title: Christine Perfect
text: Noon: Move Christine to the location of the opposing dude with the highest grit (you chose in case of a tie). That dude gets -5 value.
flavor: "Tally-ho! Try to keep up boys! This ought to be a hunt for the ages!"

title: Father Tolarios
text: Noon: Discard a card. Choose an opposing wanted dude at this or an adjacent location. Lower that dude's bounty by 1 to search your deck or discard pile for a non-Unique Miracle or non-Unique Mystical goods, reveal it, and add it to your hand.

title: Hattie DeLorre
text: Shootout: One opposing wanted dude gets -5 bullets.
flavor: "Question him all you want, but the answers might not be as edifyin' as you'd hope after I bust those teeth outta his mouth."

title: Diego Linares
text: While inventing a Horse or a Sidekick, Diego has +4 Mad Scientist skill.
flavor: "He's a master of blending the beauty of nature with the power of the new science. I've never been so disgusted." -Jon Longstride

title: POST-A-TRON
text: You can include POST-A-TRON in your starting gang. If you do, you must invent it after shuffling your deck, waiving the ghost rock cost of inventing. Discard POST-A-TRON if you fail to, or cannot, invent it. Noon, Boot: If POST-A-TRON is at the town square, gain 3 ghost rock.

title: Jimmy "The Saint"
text: While Jimmy is at a deed you control, you gain the production of that deed during Upkeep. If that deed is a Casino, it gains an additional +1 production.
flavor: "Nice place you got here. Be a real shame if something were to happen to it."

title: Mario Crane (Exp.1)
text: Mario counts as Sloane for Uniqueness. Resolution, Repeat: If your hand is illegal, reduce your casualties this round by two. If your opponent has a legal hand, you take a minimum of 1 casualty. You can only use this ability once per shootout round.

title: The Caretaker
text: While the Caretaker is at a location you own and has not moved this turn, he has +4 bullets, +4 value, and is a stud.
flavor: "I'm really gonna miss this place. Take care of it for the family, won't you, child?" -Nicodemus Whateley

title: Nickel Night Inn
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Boot a dude with a value of 3 or less at this or an adjacent location.
flavor: "Where everybody knows my name!" -Pancho Castillo

title: Sherman Mortgage
text: Boot this deed when a shootout starts. While unbooted, increase the cost of each other player's deeds by 1 for every four deeds that player owns (round down).

title: Gomorra Gaming Commission
text: Controller Cheatin' Resolution, Boot: This deed gains a permanent +1 production. Draw a card unless the cheatin' player pays you 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "I'm not sure what you'd have to do to pass inspection 'honestly'. Nobody's ever tried." -Clementine Lepp

title: Cliff's #4 Saloon
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Your dude at this location, or an adjacent location you control, becomes a stud.
flavor: "They say it's the stiffest drink in town, and buddy, they ain't kidding!" -Clyde Owens

title: Baijiu Jar
text: While at a Saloon, this dude has +3 value and +1 influence. Shootout, Boot: Discard three cards to draw four cards.
flavor: Fine, distilled spirits brewed in accordance with five thousand years of tradition. Also good for degreasing locomotive parts.

title: Bowie Knife
text: You may attach this card to your dude in a posse (paying all costs) as a shootout play. This dude is a stud. If there is an unbooted non-Melee Weapon in the opposing posse, Bowie Knife provides no bullet bonus and does not make this dude a stud.
flavor: "The difference between Francine and a woman? Francine's never left my side." -Marion Seville

title: Hydro-Puncher
text: This dude can attach two Weapons. If this dude is not a Gadget, both Weapons must be Melee. While this dude has two Weapons attached, they are a stud. Shootout, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. Boot the dude and one of their attached cards.

title: Rancher's Lariat
text: While this dude is at a Ranch, that deed gains +2 production. It cannot receive a bonus from more than one Lariat. Shootout, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. The dude cannot use their printed abilities. You may boot a Weapon on that dude.
flavor: "A rope in the hands of a cowboy can be a thing of beauty. And like many beautiful things, there comes a time when you're better off just lettin' go." -Jarrett Blake

title: De Annulos Mysteriis
text: Noon: Ace this card to search your discard pile for an action card that starts a job marking a location. Play the card, making this dude the leader if able. While leading the job, this dude has +1 bullets and is a stud.
flavor: "I'm hoping the author stopped writing before his discoveries drove him mad." -Valeria Batten

title: Heartseeker
text: Shootout Hex 5, Boot: Reduce your opponent's casualties by three this round. If you win this round, ace the opposing shooter. This acing effect cannot be prevented (even if the shooter is Harrowed).

title: Tse-Che-Nako's Weaving
text: This deed gains the Holy Ground keyword and does not unboot during Sundown. Noon Spirit 7, Boot: Move one of your dudes to a location adjacent to this Shaman. You may unboot this deed to give this Shaman 1 control point until they move.

title: Amazing Grace
text: Noon Miracle 6, Boot: This Blessed gets +1 influence and does not go home booted the next time they refuse a callout. Your other dudes get +1 influence for purposes of controlling locations. Your dudes cannot have their influence reduced by opposing abilities.

title: Burn 'Em Out
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark an opponent's home. Raise the bounty of each dude in your posse by 1. If successful, look at that opponent's play hand and ace a card from it.
flavor: "No more messing with the law. Everything burns. Everyone dies." -Mario Crane

title: Shiny Things
text: Noon: Choose an opposing dude.That dude gains +2 influence, +7 value, and cannot be called out this turn. Boot the chosen dude.
flavor: "I'll take her where she needs to go." -Pancho Castillo

title: We Got A Beef!
text: React: After an unbooted dude accepts a callout, but before posses are formed, swap the location of either the mark or leader with a dude at an adjacent location controlled by the same player. The chosen dude replaces the original mark or leader in the shootout.

title: Great Sage Matching Heaven
keywords: Technique • Tao of Bull Demon King
text: Shootout Tao Technique: This dude gets +1 Influence and gains the Harrowed keyword. Combo if your posse has equal or higher influence than the opposing posse.

title: Two Hundred Fifty Rounds
keywords: Technique • Tao of Bull Demon King
text: Shootout Tao Technique: Reduce your casualties this round by one. Combo if you control this location.

title: Moving Forward
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Search your deck and discard pile for an in-town deed and play it, reducing its cost by 5. If this card is played during lowball, pay ghost rock equal to the deed's production or discard it.
