title: The Law Goes Underground
text: Resolution: Boot or discard your stud dude. If that dude was a Deputy, send the opposing shooter home booted. Send all dudes in your posse home booted.

title: "Thunder Boy" Nabbe
text: Repeat Shootout: If there is a wanted dude in the opposing posse, Nabbe gets a bullet bonus equal to his influence and becomes a stud. You can use this ability once per shootout.

title: Dave "Slim" Gorman
text: React: After Dave casts a shootout Hex, you may discard the Hex to have all dudes in the shootout become draws for this round.
flavor: "He clawed his way up from nuthin'. And if he has his way, that's what we'll all become." -Clementine Lepp

title: Darius Hellstromme
text: If you are the leader, your shooter has -2 bullets if they do not have a Gadget Weapon attached. React, Boot: After an opposing dude is discarded or aced during a shootout, boot a Gadget Weapon in your posse to give your dude with a Gadget Weapon a permanent control point. If the opposing dude was discarded, they are aced instead.

title: Ezekiah Grimme
text: When attaching a spell to a card, increase the spell's ghost rock cost by the number of copies of that spell in play. React, Boot: After your dude successfully casts a spell attached to them, if the pull was a spell, you may attach it to that dude, booted (paying all costs). Noon, Boot: Boot your skilled dude to reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. If you revealed a spell you have less than 2 copies of in play, you may attach it to that dude (paying all costs). Shuffle the remaining revealed cards into your deck.

title: Jasper Stone
text: Except at home, only your shooter contributes to your draw hand bonuses. React, Boot: After posses are formed, choose a dude in the opposing posse. Your shooter has +2 bullets while opposing that dude, and while your posse has a non-token dude. If that opposing dude is aced, give your declared shooter a permanent control point and permanent +1 bullets.

title: Raven
text: If you are the leader, your posse has a -2 stud pentalty if it has less bullets than the opposing posse. You have an extra control point during Sundown if you control equal or more in-town deeds that you do not own compared to each other player. Noon, Boot: Choose an in-town deed. Your shooter has +2 bullets during shootouts there. The next time you win a shootout there, or if you control it during Sundown and do not own it, give your dude there a permanent +1 bullets if they do not already have a permanent bullet bonus.

title: Wang Men Wu
text: Your token dudes are ignored when checking the combo requirements of Techniques Wang Men Wu successfully performs. React: After posses are formed, if you control the mark or are opposing a job, a 2-stud Gunslinger token joins your posse, booted. Before you declare your shooter, remove the Gunslinger from play.

title: Charging Bear
text: Shootout: If Charging Bear is unbooted, ace your token dude to send an opposing dude home booted and make Charging Bear a stud.
flavor: "The spirits guard these lands, I merely point out the enemy."

title: Fears No Owls
text: Noon: Move your dude to a Holy Ground location or a deed with a totem.
flavor: "I know what is coming. There will be a flood once more."

title: Black Owl
text: Shootout: An opposing dude gets +5 value. You may boot Black Owl to make the opposing player select that dude as their first casualty this round.
flavor: "I mark our prey for later."

title: Zeb Whateley-Dupont
text: If your outfit is , Zeb is a stud, and while he is opposing a dude with grit 11 or higher in a shootout, he cannot have less than 2 bullets and cannot be changed to a draw.
flavor: "Too easy. Bring on a real challenge!"

title: Rosenbaum's Golem
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. Boot that dude, and you may give them +5 value. If that dude's grit is 11 or higher, you may unboot one of your other dudes.
flavor: "Don't think bullets are going to help with this one..."

title: Stewart Davidson
text: Noon, Boot: Discard a card. Choose an opposing dude without a bounty and pay ghost rock equal to that dude's influence to give that dude 1 bounty.
flavor: "I may have lost the hand, but you'll more than make up for it later."

title: Sheriff Eli Waters
text:
During Waters' shootout, he has a bullet bonus equal to the highest bounty among wanted dudes opposing him, to a maximum bonus of 4.

After an opposing player reveals a cheatin' hand, you may move Waters to the location of a wanted dude. If he moves to the location of a shootout, he may join your posse.

title: Adrián Vallejo
text: React: After a card ability moves a dude to a shootout location and they join a posse, if Adrián has a Horse, he joins your posse (moving if necessary).
flavor: "I don't bow or do favors. I do hunt varmints with Chags, though."

title: Prof. Aloysius Roe
text: Prof. Roe cannot invent Gadgets and has the Gadget keyword while in play. React: After a dude at this location pulls for a Mad Scientist skill check, increase the pull by Prof. Roe's Mad Scientist rating.

title: Rabid Rance Hitchcock
text:
While Rance is at a deed you control but do not own, the deed gains 1 additional control point.

While Rance is wanted, he has a bullet bonus equal to the production of the deed he is at, to a maximum of 3, and can move from home to Out of Town deeds without booting.

title: Morgan Lash
text: If your outfit is , Morgan's cost is reduced by the highest bounty among your dudes. Your shooter has +2 bullets if they have more bounty than the opposing shooter. React: After you declare your shooter, increase their bounty by 2.

title: Johnny Brocklehurst
text: React: After you declare a play, give a dude +1 or -1 influence for the duration of that play.
flavor: "He's as important or as insignificant as you want. Just remember to pay me."

title: Agent Provocateur
text: Agent Provocateur cannot enter play at a location that is not your home, leave your home, attach cards, leave Boot Hill, or have traits removed. Your dudes at this location cannot gain permanent control points except from jobs. React: After victory is checked during Sundown, ace Agent Provocateur to play a dude from your hand, reducing their cost by 4. This acing effect cannot be prevented.

title: F1 Burch
text: React: After F1 Burch enters play, move him to the in-town location of one of your other dudes. You may attach a non-Unique, non-Gadget goods from your hand or discard pile to one of your dudes at that location, reducing its cost by 1.
flavor: "They really want to know why shipping costs so much?"

title: Taff's Distillery
text: Controller React, Boot: After you successfully complete a job, not initiated by your outfit or legend, and that job did not mark your home, draw a card.
flavor: "Have you come here for your payoff, dear boy?" - "Union" Jack

title: Mausoleum
text: Controller React, Boot: After a non-token, non-Abomination dude is aced from play, this deed gains +1 permanent control points.
flavor: "Why's the door so heavy? It's jus' a bunch'a corpses!"

title: Epitaph Branch Office
text: Controller React, Boot: After victory is checked during Sundown, if you control a dude with 1 more more influence and no control points at an opposing player's home, give that dude a permanent control point.

title: Buffalo Emporium
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Your dude at this location cannot be booted or moved by opposing card effects. If that dude is an Abomination, unboot that dude, and your posse has a +1 stud bonus while that dude is in your posse.

title: Explorer's Lodge
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Move a dude at this deed to town square, booted. That dude's owner may pay 2 ghost rock to unboot them.
flavor: "Here there be monsters. And those who hunt them!" - Shelby Hunt

title: The Oriental Saloon
text: Determine control of this deed using bullets instead of influence. Controller React, Boot: After you reveal a cheatin' hand, unboot your dude in town and give that dude 2 bounty.
flavor: "Just wanted to let you know, you're sitting in my chair..."

title: Hellstromme Plant #9
text: Controller Noon/Shootout, Pay 1 Ghost Rock, Boot: Choose a dude you own and control. Unboot a Horse or Gadget attached to that dude. You can use one of the abilities on that Horse or Gadget another time this turn.

title: Bilton Collection Agency
text: Controller React, Boot: After you collect production during Upkeep, choose a deed you control but do not own. Gain ghost rock equal to its production.

title: Decimator Array
text: After you invent this Gadget, unboot one of your Mad Scientists. If this dude is a Mad Scientist, they have -1 upkeep, +3 value, and this Gadget gains the Sidekick keyword. Resolution, Boot: Choose a card in your draw hand. If it is a heart, change its value; otherwise, change its suit to hearts.

title: Devil's Six Gun
text: This dude is a stud. Cheatin' Resolution, Boot: Search your Boot Hill, discard pile, and deck for a joker. Put the joker in your draw hand, declare a suit and value for it, and discard a card from your draw hand. Before you discard your draw hand, shuffle the joker back into your deck.

title: The Bloody Star
text:
Cannot attach to or be traded to a Deputy. After this card enters play, give this dude 2 bounty.

This dude cannot refuse callouts from dudes without bounty. This dude can be called out while at their own home.
flavor: "Another one to add to the collection..." - Stone

title: Forsaken Hound
text: Resolution, Boot: This dude and an opposing dude cannot flee this round.
flavor:
"He's back, as if it never happened." - Lucy Clover

"Wouldn't be the first time." - Black Jack

title: Cavalry Escort
text: React, Boot: Before you assign casualties, this dude joins your posse booted (moving if necessary). React abilities cannot increase casualties this round.
flavor: "Sometimes even I need help bringing hot goods into Gomorra." - F1 Burch

title: Nightmare Realm
text: Shootout Hex 3, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. That dude cannot leave the shootout this round. Each round before shooters are declared, give that dude -1 bullets and -1 value. Give your dude +1 bullets.
flavor: "They seek only to spread fear, death, and destruction." - Wovoka

title: Sentinel
text: Noon Miracle 5, Boot: This dude gains +1 bullets, +1 Blessed skill rating, and becomes a stud. You may move this dude to an adjacent location or town square. If this dude is in town square during Sundown, you may discard this spell after victory is checked to give this dude a permanent control point.
flavor: "Thou has rejected the word of the Lord, and the Lord hath rejected thee!"

title: Censure
text: Cheatin' Resolution Miracle 6, Boot: You may increase a player's hand rank by 2. If this is a shootout, reduce your casualties by 3 and you may send an opposing dude home booted.
flavor: "Your magic has no effect on me, Lash." - Rev. Perry Inbody

title: Raven's Ruin
text: Attaches only to deeds. Noon Spirit 8, Boot: Move your dude at any location to this deed. If you do not own this deed and it has 1 or more control points, you may boot it to gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "You are only alive because we allow it." - Raven

title: Remedy
text: Shootout Spirit 7, Boot: Choose a dude. Remove all bullet modifiers from that dude, except from their attached Weapons. That dude cannot leave the shootout via card effects this round.
flavor: "There will be a Great Medicine Dance like nothing the tribes have seen..." - Jordrava

title: Intercession
text: React Miracle 5, Boot: After an opposing dude becomes a stud, make one of your dudes a stud. Shootout Miracle 7, Boot: Choose your dude and an opposing dude. Each of those dudes unboots and gets +2 bullets.

title: Disarm
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Choose an opposing dude. Boot one of their attachments. If this is a shootout, ace the attachment or discard it if it is Unique instead. You ignore all casualties this round. If your hand is legal, one of your dudes gets +2 bullets and becomes a stud until after Sundown.
flavor: "I didn't save my last incendiary shell for you, bastard..."

title: Grim Servant O' Death
text: Shootout: Choose a dude who is not in the shootout, who is at home, and who is controlled by the mark or the player opposing a job. That dude's controller may have them join their posse (moving if necessary). If that dude does not join, one of your dudes becomes a stud, gets +2 bullets, and your opponent takes two extra casualties if their draw hand is ever cheatin' this round.

title: Behold White Bull
keywords: Headline • Technique • Tao of Bull Demon King
text: Shootout Tau Technique, Boot: Increase the casualties of both posses this round by this dude's influence. Your opponent may send all dudes in their posse home booted. If they do, this dude permanently gets +2 control points and unboots.
flavor: "There's a reson you don't let the bull in the china shop." - Xui Yin Chen

title: You Had ONE Job!
text: Shootout: Choose a wanted dude with 3 or more bounty. Make them a stud or draw. Resolution: All players who revealed a legal hand may reduce their casualties by 2.
flavor: "It wasn't supposed to go down like this!" - Ulysses Marks

title: Friends in High Places
text: React: After your unbooted dude is called out, if they have more influence than the leader, they can refuse the callout without moving home booted. Shootout: If your posse has more influence than the opposing posse, make one of your dudes a stud.
flavor: "Trigger the flood. Destroy the city. Kill the 13." - Sees Far Ahead

title: Shan Fan Showdown!
text: React: After posses are formed, choose your dude with a Melee Weapon in your posse. That dude unboots and becomes a stud. For the remainder of the shootout, React, Shootout, and non-Cheatin' Resolution abilities cannot increase or decrease hand ranks or increase or decrease casualties.
flavor: "The Maze was not meant for you." - Chung Tzu

title: The Winning Agenda
text: Noon: Choose your dude and discard cards equal to their influence, to a maximum of 3. Draw cards equal to their influence, to a maximum of 3. Cheatin' Resolution: Choose your dude. Increase your hand rank by their influence, to a maximum bonus of 3.

title: 108 Gracious Gifts
text: While you have less ghost rock than each other player, you may discard an extra card at Sundown. Noon, Pay 2 Ghost Rock, Boot: Unboot your dude.

title: Property Is Theft
text: After your opponent reveals a cheatin' hand during a shootout, they must pay the bank 1 ghost rock, if able. If your hand is legal, they pay you instead. React, Boot: After you pay another player at least 1 ghost rock, draw a card. If this is a shootout, draw an additional card. You may discard 1 card, or up to 2 if this is a shootout.

title: The Spiritual Society
text: After refilling your hand during Sundown, if you have equal or more influence in town square than each other player, draw a card. Noon, Boot: Boot your dude to boot an opposing dude with less influence at the same location.

title: Joe Vermilion
text: Noon: If Joe is at deed you do not own, pay the owner 1 ghost rock to gain ghost rock equal to that deed's production.
flavor: "His hunger for better pay outweighs his hunger for flesh." - He Fang

title: Ying-Ssi Chieh T'ang
text: Resolution: Pay the opposing posse's controller 1 ghost rock. Draw a card and place it in your draw hand. Discard a card from your draw hand.
flavor: "They call her the Goddess of Colors... as beautiful as she is deadly." -T'ou Chi Chow

title: E Gui
text: React: Before E Gui leaves play because you did not pay his upkeep, if E Gui is at a deed you do not own, boot the deed and gain ghost rock equal to the deed’s production.
flavor: "It pays to have friends in low places." -Daomei Wang

title: Buskers
text: React: After an opposing dude moves to this location and that dude's controller has more ghost rock than you, that dude's controller must pay you 2 ghost rock. If they do not, boot that dude.
flavor: "It's amazing how much money a little flamenco can bring in"

title: Taiyari
text: Shootout: Choose your dude. Pay the opposing posse's controller ghost rock equal to that dude's bullets to make that dude a stud. If that dude has 0 bullets, pay 1 ghost rock instead. That dude has a maximum bullet rating of 4.
flavor: "The goal of the 108 is a just one."

title: Matilda Loomis
flavor: "Something is plaguing Tombstone, and I'm going to find out who, or what, is responsible. The spirits will guide us, and they will forgive us if we must commit violence to bring peace to this town."

title: Alexander Sequoia
text: While Alexander is in town square, you may discard an extra card from your hand at Sundown. Noon: If Alexander is in town square, unboot Alexander.
flavor: "He's more a product of my world than of his own people." - Richard Faulkner

title: Matthew Rising Sun
text: Matthew can cast Totems as if he had Shaman skill equal to his Kung Fu rating (he does not gain the Shaman keyword while casting a Totem).
flavor: "Seeing him use the ways of our brothers from the Far East makes those ways seem even stranger." -Laughing Crow

title: Feichi "Suitcase" Lee
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose a dude in the posse opposing Feichi. Boot that dude. If Feichi has more influence than that dude, one of your other dudes at any location may join your posse (moving if necessary).

title: Geronimo
text: Noon: If Geronimo is not at your home, discard a card you do not own attached to Geronimo’s current location and gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Live well the life the creator intended for you."

title: Papa Marias
text: Noon: Choose your unbooted Huckster at another location and Marias makes a Huckster skill check of 7. If successful, move that Huckster to Marias's location.
flavor: "I don't care if they're at our door, the ritual must be completed!"

title: Skinwalker
text: Shootout: Boot your Abomination dude. Either boot an opposing attachment at this location or give Skinwalker +2 bullets.
flavor: "Become the Goddess, my child. Let us show her the true power in Tombstone." -Baron LaCroix

title: Tonton Macoute
text: Shootout: Choose an opposing dude. Give that dude -2 bullets or boot a Weapon on that dude.
flavor: "Go, my servant, block the doors!" - Papa Marias

title: Kevin Wainwright (Exp.1)
text: Noon/Shootout: Move Kevin to a location with a Huckster or Abomination dude. If this is a shootout play, the location must be the shootout location. Kevin joins your posse. Kevin becomes a stud and if there is an opposing dude with grit 11 or higher at that location, draw two cards.
flavor: "Masters come and go. I remain as faithful as ever."

title: Padre Ernesto de Diaz
text: After your opponent reveals a cheating hand, you may boot a miracle on Ernesto to draw a card
flavor: "The one the newspapers call 'The Deathly Drifter'- he is not a man. Perhaps he once was, but no longer. His name is Jasper Stone."

title: Dr. Erik Yaple
text: React: After posses are formed, boot a gadget weapon in your posse to give a dude without a bounty in the opposing posse 1 bounty.
flavor: "Mr. Ketchum, I assure you there are no so-called 'flying discs' around these parts. Nothing to see here."

title: Quincy Washburne
text: React: After Quincy successfully invents a Weapon Gadget, unboot him.
flavor: "The arsenal may be lost, but there are still scientists who believe in justice." -Janosz Pratt

title: Xiong "Wendy" Cheng (Exp.1)
text: Opposing wanted dudes at Wendy’s location have -2 value. Shootout, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. Send them home booted. If they have bounty greater than their grit, discard them.

title: Takahashi Jinrai
text: Noon Job: Mark an in-town deed you own whose cost is at least 2 ghost rock greater than its current production. If successful, the deed permanently gains +1 production.
flavor: "Deeds, why didn't you tell me they would have flamethrowers?!"

title: "Handsome" Dan Deeds
text: Noon, Boot: If Dan is at in-town deed you own that has less than 2 control points, the deed gains a control point. After victory is checked during Sundown, if Dan has not moved, you may pay 4 ghost rock to make the control point permanent.
flavor: "I assure you both, the danger in Tombstone is not of this world."

title: Vida Azul
text: Noon: Discard a card and choose a dude with a Horse at this or an adjacent location. Unboot that horse. Its abilities may be used an additional time this turn. If you discarded a Goods, you may unboot that dude.

title: Bartholomew P. Fountain
text: Noon, Boot: Boot a Ranch you control to move a dude at this or an adjacent location to another location you own or control.
flavor: "He's too busy with the women in this town to pay attention. Hit his ranch tomorrow, boys." - Ike Clanton

title: Ike Clanton
text: Noon, Boot: Give a deed the Rowdy keyword. This effect lasts until after the next Upkeep phase. (Control of a Rowdy deed is checked with bullets instead of influence.)
flavor: "I'm lookin' for Holliday or an Earp. You find 'em, and you tell 'em they got a fight comin'!"

title: Frank Stillwell
text: After Frank joins the mark's posse or a posse opposing a job, if he is wanted, he unboots. React: After posses are formed, if Frank is in your posse, send him home booted.
flavor: "The man who killed my brother wore the red sash!" -Wyatt Earp

title: Silas Aims (Exp.1)
text: Silas has a bullet bonus equal to his bounty, to a maximum bonus of 4. Shootout, Boot: Send an opposing dude with less bullets than Silas's bounty home booted. If Silas is the mark, he ignores the boot cost of this ability.

title: Larry "Sevens" Swift
text: React: After posses are formed, if Larry is in your posse, boot Larry 's spell to boot an attachment in the opposing posse and increase Larry's bounty by 1. If you are not the Winner, Larry must be unbooted.
flavor: "Give Sevens my regards, Valeria." -Maria Kingsford

title: Virginia Ann Earp
text: While Virginia is in a shootout, hand ranks cannot be modified by Shootout, React, or non-Cheatin' Resolution abilities.
flavor: "I may not be there to save you next time, brother. You need to be more careful."

title: Campbell & Hatch Billiard Parlor
text: Controller React, Boot: After posses are formed, for the remainder of the shootout, hand ranks cannot be modified Shootout, React, or non-Cheatin' Resolution abilities. Dudes cannot be discarded or aced by Shootout or non-Cheatin' Resolution abilities during the first round.

title: Clanton Ranch
text: Noon, Boot: If you are not the Winner, gain 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "By now they've got that place penned up tight. We need a solid plan to get them outta there without gettin' ourselves killed." -Virgil Earp

title: Concordia Cemetery
text: Controller React, Boot: Before a non-token dude opposing your dude is aced in a shootout, give this deed a permanent +1 production. If that dude had grit 11 or higher, give this deed a permanent control point.
flavor: Not all dangers are of the living.

title: Ike's Place
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Choose a deed on this street or a deed you control. Reduce its control points and production to 0 until after the next Upkeep Phase.
flavor: "Leave it be, Earp. You don't need this kinda trouble."

title: Five Aces Gambling Hall
text: React, Boot: After posses are formed, if you own the mark, one of your wanted dudes joins your posse (moving if necessary).
flavor: "Ain't you a sight for sore eyes. How's things in the old Doomtown?" -Charlie Landers

title: Old Washoe Club
text: Controller Shootout, Boot: Send an opposing A-value dude home booted. Controller Shootout, Boot: Discard a Sidekick.
flavor: "You have to be somebody to get in a fight in that place."

title: Quarter Horse
text: React, Boot: After this dude’s posse succeeds at a job that didn’t mark your home, this dude stays at this location instead of going home booted.
flavor: "Not the fastest, but always fearless." -Jarett Blake

title: Electrostatic Pump Gun
text: Shootout, Boot: Give an opposing dude -1 bullets. Pull. If the pull was not a club, the opposing dude becomes a draw if they have 0 bullets.
flavor: "Fires just like a Smith & Robards, 'cept it can kill ya." -Dr. Erik Yaple

title: Claws
text:
This dude is a stud.

This card cannot be attached or traded to a dude without the Harrowed or Abomination keyword. This card cannot be affected by opposing card effects.

If there is an unbooted non-Melee Weapon in the opposing posse, Claws provides no bullet bonus and does not make this dude a stud.

title: Analytical Cognisizer
text: After you invent this Gadget, unboot this Mad Scientist and draw a card. React, Boot: After making a pull for a Gadget at this or an adjacent location, discard a goods card from your plan hand to make the pull's suit hearts.

title: Ranger's Bible
text: Cheatin’ Resolution, Boot: If your draw hand is legal this shootout round, lower a player’s hand rank by this dude’s influence, to a maximum reduction of 4.
flavor: Ranger Hank Ketchum had been one of Tombstone's finest.

title: Stone's Colt Dragoons
text: React, Boot: After an opposing dude joins this shootout by a card effect, boot that dude. That dude does not unboot at Sundown.
flavor: "I know a fella who knows exactly what Stone's weakness is." -Coot Jenkins

title: Bedazzle
text: Cheatin' Resolution Hex 3, Boot: Lower a player’s hand rank by 2. If this is a shootout, give an opposing dude a bullet penalty equal to their current bullets that lasts the remainder of the shootout.
flavor: "Cover your eyes, darlin'" -Doc Holliday

title: Exultant Translocation
text: Noon Miracle 6, Boot: Choose your dude at a different location than this dude. This dude moves to the location of the other dude, and the other dude moves to the previous location of this dude. If you succeed by 6 or more, unboot one of the dudes.

title: Retribution
text: Shootout Miracle X, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. X is that dude's value. If that dude's controller reveals a cheating hand this round and you reveal a legal hand, ace that dude. This acing effect cannot be prevented.

title: Gateway
text: Noon Hex 6, Boot: Move your Abomination at this location to another location. Shootout Hex 6, Boot: Your Abomination joins your posse (moving if necessary).

title: Guiding Wind
text: Shootout Spirit 8, Boot: Choose an opposing dude or your non-token dude. Set that dude’s bullets to equal to their influence, or 3, whichever is lower.
flavor: "May the spirit of the crow aid us." -Enapay

title: Mischievous Coyote
text: Shootout Spirit 9, Boot: Switch your total stud bonus and total draw bonus when making draw hands this round. You must have at least 1 non-token stud dude and 1 non-token draw dude in your posse to use this ability.

title: Murdered in Tombstone
text: Shootout: Your dude becomes a stud. Each posse’s controller may search their deck and discard pile for an action card with a Cheatin’ Resolution ability, reveal it, and add it to their hand. If a player added a card to their hand, they discard a card.

title: Hostile Takeover
text: Noon: Boot your stud at a deed you control but do not own. Boot that deed to gain ghost rock equal to your stud’s bullets, to a maximum of 3. You may ace this card to give that deed a permanent +1 control point and that dude a permanent +1 influence.

title: Jade King Stance
text: Noon Technique: Unboot this dude. They gain +2 Kung Fu, +2 bullets, and cannot move from this location.
flavor: "It was a terror beyond anything I've created." -Valeria Batten

title: Heist
text: Noon Job: Mark an in-town deed. Your posse must have 3 or more bullets. If successful, gain ghost rock equal to the mark's production and raise the leader's bounty by 2. If you do not own the mark, unboot your leader.
flavor: "Jollifications!" -Ike Clanton

title: I'm Your Huckleberry
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Your opponent chooses a dude in their posse. That dude joins your posse under your control for the remainder of the shootout. After the shootout ends, if that dude is still in play, send that dude home booted. If your hand is legal, you choose the opposing dude.

title: Monkey Goes to the Mountain
text: Shootout Technique: If this dude is unbooted, choose an opposing dude with bullets equal to or less than this dude's Kung Fu rating. Move both dudes to an adjacent non-home location (without booting and even if booted). Both dudes leave the shootout.

title: Curse of Failure
text: This dude loses all keywords, traits, and abilities. This dude’s bullets, influence, and control points are equal to 0 and cannot be modified. This dude gets +1 upkeep. This card cannot be discarded by card effects. Noon Job, Boot: Mark an opposing dude. If successful, discard all cards attached to the mark and send them home booted; attach this card to the mark.

title: Ricochet
text: Cheatin' Resolution: The cheating player discards their shooter. If your hand is legal, you do not take casualties this round and draw a card.
flavor: "Only one way outta this alive, and that's you showin' me the trick of that hexslingin'." -Doc Holliday

title: House of Many Faiths
text: Noon, Boot: Choose your dude with a Miracle, and shuffle a card from your hand and a card from your discard pile into your deck. That dude moves to the town square, unboots, and gets +1 influence.

title: Office of Ancestral Affairs
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark an in-town deed with less than 2 control points. Your posse must have 3 or more bullets. If successful, the mark permanently gains +1 control points. If unopposed, you may attach a Totem from your discard pile to the mark even if you don't control it or have a Shaman there.

title: Bayou Vermilion Railroad
text: Reduce the cost of the first Mystical card you play each turn by 1. Noon, Boot: Boot your Mystical card at a deed. Gain 1 ghost rock, and you may reduce the deed's control points and production to 0 until after the next Upkeep phase.

title: Fort 51
text: React: After you invent a Gadget Weapon or Gadget dude, give 1 bounty to an opposing dude with influence less than the Gadget's printed cost. Noon, Boot: Boot your Gadget that is not at your home and remove 1 bounty from an opposing dude. Gain 1 ghost rock and you may discard a card.

title: Smith & Robards Trade Show
text: Noon, Boot: Boot your Gadget goods to discard a card and then draw a card. If that Gadget is at a location you control but do not own, that Gadget gains a control point (until the end of the turn).

title: Jonah's Alliance
text: Noon, Boot: Boot your dude at a non-home location. That dude becomes a stud, uses bullets instead of influence to control deeds, and gains 2 bounty, to a maximum of 4 bounty. You may boot your Hex (at any location) to remove all traits, abilities, and bonuses from an attachment at that dude's location.

title: Doc Holliday
text: If you are the leader and do not have a spellcaster in your posse, your posse has a -2 stud penalty. Shootout, Boot: Give your dude a bullet bonus equal to the spellcaster skill rating of a dude in this shootout. That dude has a maximum bullet rating of 4.

title: Ke Wang
text: Shootout: Pay an opposing dude's controller that dude's upkeep. Boot that dude and give them -1 bullets.

title: Baijiu Sue
text: While Sue is at a Saloon deed, the deed has +1 control points.
flavor: "I'll drink to Xui Yin's memory, just as soon as I've finished living up to her memory by kickin' your butts!"

title: Reverend Bob Hungate
text: Resolution, Boot: Choose a dude in your posse and pay the opposing player ghost rock equal to that dude's influence. Your opponent chooses a dude in their posse. Both dudes cannot be chosen as casualties this shootout round.

title: Father Diamond
text: Noon: If Diamond is at a deed you do not own, pay the owner 1 ghost rock. You may send one of your dudes at the deed home. Move Diamond to another location.

title: Master Shou
text: Noon: Boot your Abomination dude at this or an adjacent deed. The deed's owner must pay you 1 ghost rock, if able.
flavor: "The Feng Shui of this place is all wrong. That's what's attracting your evil spirits."

title: Brother Petrovic
text: React: When Petrovic would be discarded or aced during a shootout, the opposing player must pay you ghost rock equal to his influence, if able.
flavor: "My faith gives me the strength to resist... most temptations"

title: Leychaa'i Youngheart
text: Noon/Shootout: Move a non-Spirit Sidekick from your dude at this or an adjacent location to another of your dudes at this or an adjacent location.
flavor: "I too have fought against the infected. I look forward to hearing more of your stories, Miss Cheng."

title: Monomi Miles
text: Resolution, Boot: If your hand is legal and your hand rank is higher, boot Miles's Sidekick to increase the casualties of both posses by his Kung Fu rating.

title: Klah
text: Shootout, Boot: Boot Klah's Sidekick to give your dude with a Sidekick +1 bullets.
flavor: "The Navajo fight against the evil deep in the Petrified Forest, and it is kin to what you face here. We will help you hunt this threat."

title: Black Elk (Exp.1)
text: If Black Elk is at a deed, he uses his Shaman skill rating to check control of the deed instead of his influence.
flavor: "I would not have wished your fate upon anyone, Matilda, but you are still needed in this world."

title: Nathaniel Tuwikaa
text: Noon: Nathaniel calls out a dude at his location. When forming shootout hands this shootout, all dudes use their influence instead of bullets to determine how many cards each player draws (but keep their bullet type).
flavor: "He's such a blowhard, even the winds have trouble matching him!" -Laughing Crow

title: The Faceless One
text: Shootout: Choose an opposing dude. The Faceless One gets a bullet bonus equal to that dude’s bullets, to a maximum bonus of 4. If that dude has grit 11 or higher, that dude has a maximum bullet rating of 4.

title: Lorena Corbett
text: Shootout: Choose an opposing dude. That dude is considered to have a minimum grit of 11 for your card effects. You may boot Lorena's Mystical goods to boot that dude.
flavor: "My feathered friends have told me of your nightmares, Miss Cheng."

title: Auntie Sinister
text: While Auntie Sinister has a Mystical goods and is in a posse, she gets a bonus to her Huckster skill equal to her influence. React: After Auntie Sinister passes a Huckster skill check by 6 or more during a shootout, she gains +2 bullets.
flavor: "I won't let you down, Marias."

title: Mason Adler
text: Mason cannot have non-Melee Weapons attached. Noon Job, Boot: Mark the opposing dude with the highest grit of 11 or higher (you choose in case of a tie). No other dudes can join your posse. If successful, ace the mark. Repeat Shootout: If an opposing dude with the highest grit is in the opposing posse, Mason gains the Abomination keyword and becomes a stud. You can use this ability once per shootout.

title: Enrique Dos Santos
text: React: After a wanted dude who is not at home accepts a callout from Enrique, other dudes cannot join the mark's posse until after posses are formed.
flavor: "He's got a bullet saved for Deputy DeLorre's killer." -Lucy Clover

title: Reverend Endicott
text: React: After you attach a miracle to Endicott, choose an opposing dude with lower influence than the number of miracles attached to Endicott to raise that dude's bounty by 1.

title: Sgt. Elijah Clay
text: After each Shootout play (including passing) while Elijah is in your posse, if the opposing posse has greater total bounty than total bullets, Elijah becomes a stud and has a minimum bullet rating of 3.

title: Wyatt Earp
text: If your outfit is , reduce Wyatt's cost by 2 for each of your dudes in Boot Hill. While Wyatt is in your posse, your shooter gets +2 bullets if the opposing shooter's bounty is greater than their bullets. Cheatin' Resolution: Ace the opposing shooter or a wanted dude in the opposing posse.

title: Eli Leatherwood
flavor: "You don't thing the world has changed? You should see the critter hides he has for sale these days. Chupacabra, serpents the size of men, werewolf, catamount! And that's just what he has on display in public." -"Handsome" Dan Deeds

title: Roberto Muratore
text: Noon: Boot Roberto's Experimental Gadget at your in-town deed with 1 control point and pull twice. If one pull was red, give this deed a control point. If both pulls are red, that control point is permanent.
flavor: "Science has come to Tombstone!"

title: Adelaide Rose
text: Shootout: Boot Adelaide's Gadget to give an opposing dude -1 bullets. If that Gadget is Experimental, give your dude +1 bullets.
flavor: "I've already started putting the gadgets Boldman left behind to good use. Just look at this!"

title: Dr. Gregory Tremane
text: If your outfit is , reduce Gregory's cost by the number of Gadgets you control. Shootout: Boot a Gadget in your posse to send an opposing dude without a Gadget home booted.

title: Big Nose Kate
text: Noon: Discard a card to give your dude at this location +1 bullets. If you discarded an action card with a Shootout or Job ability, that dude gets +1 influence. If that dude is not wanted, you may give that dude 1 bounty.
flavor: "For better or worse, you sure make my blood boil, Doc."

title: Johnny Ringo
text: If Johnny is wanted and the only dude in your posse, only shooters contribute to draw hand bonuses. Shootout: Until the next round of this shootout, dudes cannot be chosen or affected by their opponent's React, Shootout, or non-Cheatin' Resolution abilities.

title: Violet Esperanza
text: Shootout: Choose an opposing dude with bullets less than Violet's bounty while Violet is attempting a job. Ace Violet's Hex and pull. If the pull is greater than that dude's value, ace that dude.
flavor: "Find Morgan Lash, at any cost."

title: Curly Bill Brocius
text: After you reveal a higher hand rank than the opposing posse during a shootout, give one of your dudes 1 bounty. React, Boot: After you win a shootout round with Curly Bill in your posse, if your posse has more total bounty than the opposing posse, the opposing posse takes 2 extra casualties.

title: Byron Decker
text: While Byron has a Gadget Weapon, he gets +1 influence. React: Before Byron is aced as a casualty, by a Shootout ability, or by a non-Cheatin’ Resolution ability, discard another of your dudes in your posse to prevent Byron from being aced.

title: Carter Richardson
text: If there is a wanted dude in the opposing posse, you may play Carter from your hand (into your posse) as a Shootout play, paying his cost. Noon: Move Carter to the location of a wanted dude with the highest bounty (you choose in case of a tie).

title: Valeria Batten (Exp.1)
text: Valeria can invent Mystical Gadgets using her Huckster skill. While Valeria is in a shootout, hand ranks cannot be modified by Shootout, React, or non-Cheatin' Resolution abilities. Noon: Boot your dude and give them +1 influence.

title: Steph & Gertie's Tonsorium
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck. Discard the top card of your deck.
flavor: "The finest cut for locals and their furry friends alike!" -Taiyari

title: Gateway Station
text: Controller React, Pay 1 Ghost Rock, Boot: Before discarding your lowball draw hand, discard a card from your play hand. Take a dude card from your lowball draw hand and put them into your play hand.

title: Hart's Tea Shoppe
text: Controller Shootout, Boot: Boot an opposing card.
flavor: "Over forty different kinds of tea, but not a single drop of liquor? I don't get it." -Ulysses Marks

title: Bird Cage Theater
text: Controller Noon Job, Boot: Mark an opposing dude with 1 or more control points. If successful, remove all control points from the mark and this deed gains a permanent +1 control point and +1 production.

title: Cochise County Courthouse
text: Controller Noon Job, Boot: Mark the town square. Your posse must have 4 or more bullets. If successful, you may pay ghost rock equal to an opposing dude's influence to boot all cards attached to that dude and move that dude to town square booted.

title: Gage Export Co.
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Shuffle a card in your discard pile into your deck. Discard the top card of your deck.
flavor: "Phineas continues to provide us a front for supplies. Extend the same to the Twilight Legion." -Byron Decker

title: Magnum Opus Tenebri
text: A Huckster can invent this Gadget using their Huckster skill. Shootout, Boot: Boot this dude to send an opposing dude with value less than your posse's total bullets home booted. If that dude’s value is less than your posse’s total bullets by 4 or more, you may ace your Abomination dude to ace that dude.

title: Scattergun
text: Shootout, Boot: If this dude has 1 or more bullets, discard a token dude or a Sidekick with cost equal to or less than this dude’s bullets. Shootout, Boot: An opposing dude with 0 influence does not contribute to draw hand bonuses unless they are the shooter.

title: Adler's Needle
text: Shootout, Boot: Choose an opposing dude at this or an adjacent location not in the shootout. That dude’s controller may have that dude join their posse. If that dude does not join, this dude gains a permanent control point. If this dude has higher grit than that dude and they do not join, that dude gets -1 influence while not at home until after Sundown.

title: Wrathful Spider
text: Cheatin' Resolution Spirit 5, Boot: Send the opposing shooter home booted. Shootout Spirit 6, Boot: Give an opposing dude -1 bullets. If successful by 6 or more, boot that dude.

title: Guiding Light
text: Noon Miracle 5, Boot: Pay another player 1 ghost rock to send your dude at this or an adjacent location home. If you have less ghost rock than that player, unboot that dude. Noon Miracle 5, Boot: Pay another player 2 ghost rock to send that player’s dude at this or an adjacent location home.

title: Champion
text: Cheatin' Resolution Miracle 6, Boot: Gain 1 ghost rock. Shootout Miracle 8, Boot: Boot your dude to make them a stud. If that dude is discarded or aced, gain 1 ghost rock.

title: Malison
text: Shootout Hex 9, Boot: Choose an opposing dude. Your posse gets a +1 draw hand bonus of that dude’s bullet type while that dude is in the shootout. If that dude is aced or discarded during this shootout, give this dude a permanent +1 influence.

title: Dancing Butterfly
text: Resolution Spirit 10, Boot: If your hand is legal, the opposing player can have a second Cheatin' Resolution played against them. The opposing player may cancel this effect by sending one of their dudes home booted and giving one of your deeds a permanent control point (opponent chooses deed).

title: Ten-Foot Punch
text: Shootout Technique: This dude gets +1 Kung Fu and joins your posse. If this dude has a Kung Fu rating greater than or equal to the bullet rating of an opposing dude, reveal the top 5 cards of your deck and you may add a non-Tao Technique to your hand from those cards. Discard all other revealed cards.

title: Fleet-Footed
text: Noon: Send your dude home booted. Shootout: Give your dude +1 bullets and an opposing dude -1 bullets.
flavor: "Dive for cover, lead's a-flyin'!" -Ike Clanton

title: You're A Daisy If You Do
text: Noon: Boot your stud in town square to move an opposing dude to town square. If that dude has more control points than your stud, boot the opposing dude; otherwise, unboot the opposing dude. Your stud calls out that dude.

title: Twilight Is Upon Us
text: Shootout: All shooters have +2 bullets while in a posse with a skilled dude. Your skilled dude joins your posse (moving if necessary).
flavor: "Agents and Texas Rangers both have put aside their differences to ensure humanity's survival." -Elijah Clay

title: Test of Wills
text: Shootout: Boot an opposing card. If it is a goods or spell, it loses all abilities, traits, and bonuses. React: After posses are formed, if your posse has more total bullets than the opposing posse, shootout plays cannot cause dudes to join posses or cause dudes to leave the shootout.

title: Andrew Lane
text: If you are the leader, your dudes without Weapons have -1 bullets. Shootout, Boot: Attach a Non-Unique Weapon from your hand to one of your non-token dudes.

title: Hank Ketchum
text: If you are the leader, you must choose your highest grit dude in your posse as your shooter. Resolution, Boot: If your posse only contains a single dude, and that dude has at least 1 printed influence, that dude gains Harrowed for this shootout round.

title: Lacy O'Malley
text:
Card effects cannot cause cards to leave your discard pile, and cards in your discard pile cannot be played.

During Sundown, discard all cards in your hand.

title: The Tombstone Haint
text: The Haint has +2 influence during the Upkeep phase.
flavor: "Ever since I first banished him in South Carolina, he appears at another stop on my journeys, and I get paid to banish him again. It's a nice arrangement we have." -Master Shou

title: Rock Woofstone
text: Repeat Noon: Pay an opponent 1 ghost rock to move Rock to town square.
flavor: "Each town we stop in, he makes it a point to have at least one night out and visit every saloon in town, no matter how many there are." -Taiyari

title: Arielle Moriah
text: React: After Arielle boots to use an ability on a Miracle, unboot her.
flavor: "May Loko's blessing soothe your wounds and Erzulie Freda's soothe your soul"

title: Gabriel Prior
text: Increase Gabriel's Blessed skill checks by the number of your other dudes at this location.
flavor: "It doesn't matter if I believe this nonsense, I'll make 'em believe it for me."

title: Mr. Baird
text: Noon, Pay 1 Ghost Rock, Boot: Discard a deed from your play hand to put an in-town deed from your discard pile into your play hand.
flavor: "A pleasure doing business with you Mr. Essex. I'll arrange for Mr. Healey to make the delivery."

title: Harlan Stanton
text: Harlan is a stud while at a Ranch. Shootout: If this shootout is at a Ranch, Harlan joins your posse (moving if necessary).
flavor: "Those law women saved my children. You'll get no help from me, Curly."

title: Dr. Delphi Wallis
text: Shootout: Boot Delphi or her Gadget to make a Mad Scientist skill check against an opposing dude's grit. If successful, choose an ability printed on that dude. That dude cannot use the ability until after the Sundown phase.

title: Cooper Grannon
text: Noon: Boot Cooper's Gadget to pull. If the Gadget is Experimental make an additional pull. For each pull, if it is a: * Diamond, draw a card then discard a card * Heart, Cooper gains +2 bullets * Spade, Coop gains +1 influence * Club, boot Cooper

title: Vivene Goldsun
text: If Vivene has a Mystical goods, she is a stud. Shootout, Boot: Discard one of Vivene's Mystical goods to choose an opposing dude with grit lower than that goods' value. Send that dude home booted.

title: Maurice Croker
text: Shootout: If there are no studs in your posse, choose an opposing dude. That dude becomes a draw.
flavor: "Bayou Vermilion has deeper plans than the Cowboys realize. I'm here to ensure they continue past this conflict."

title: Bogie Man
text:
While you have no dudes in Boot Hill, Bogie Man has +1 influence.

Bogie Man gains a bullet bonus equal to the highest printed influence in any Boot Hill.
flavor: "Goodnight and sleep tight..."

title: Evan Lucas
text: If Evan Lucas is in your posse, you gain 1 ghost rock whenever an opposing dude is aced.
flavor: "Magic, money, mischief, mayhem... Evan! Lucas! What have you scamps done now?" -Nicole Sumner

title: Tawodi
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark the town square. If successful, choose a dude or deed in your discard pile and play it, lowering the cost by 2, to a minimum of 1.
flavor: "The Spirits show me what's on the horizon, and I see darkness. It's changing the past as we know it..."

title: Tsintah
text: Shootout: Boot Tsintah's Spirit or a Totem at this location to make her a stud. If this location is Holy Ground, or is a deed adjacent to Holy Ground, Tsintah gets +1 bullets.

title: Jackie Sanjuro
text:
Jackie cannot have non-Melee Weapons attached.


While Jackie is the only dude in your posse, he has +4 value and is a stud.
flavor: "He can't recall his past, but he certainly hasn't forgotten how to fight!" -Richard Faulkner

title: Speaks-with-Buffalo
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark an opposing dude. Speaks-with-Buffalo becomes a stud. When forming draw hands this shootout, all dudes use their influence instead of bullets to determine how many cards each player draws (but keep their bullet types). If successful, unboot Speaks-with-Buffalo, draw 2 cards, and then discard 2 cards.

title: Judge Wells Spicer
text: Noon, Boot: Send an opposing dude at this location with more bounty than influence home booted. That dude's owner may reduce that dude's bounty to 0.
flavor: "So, Miss Clover, you say that the Earps were acting in self defense?"

title: Joan McGruder
text:
Joan has -1 bullets for each other dude in her posse.

Joan cannot flee or be sent home from a shootout.

Joan's attached cards cannot affect opposing dudes unless they have bounty higher than their influence.

title: Virgil Earp
text: Cheatin' Resolution: Choose up to three bounty on dudes in the opposing posse. If your hand is legal, you may choose up to five bounty. Lower your opponent's hand rank by that amount. Your opponent may remove the chosen bounty.

title: Marshal Caves Callarman
text:
Caves has -1 bullets and -1 influence for each bounty he has.

Noon: If Caves is at a Public location, discard a card to reduce his bounty by 1.
flavor: "We all gotta play by the rules."

title: Florentino "Indian Charlie" Cruz
text:
Charlie has a +1 value for each bounty he has.

While Charlie's bounty is greater than 3, he cannot be changed to a draw.
flavor: "The Earp rampage escalated into a showdown with the Cowboys, but the end of that madness gave rise to another far worse." -Lacy O'Malley

title: Tomas Ramirez
text: Shootout: Boot Tomas's Hex to make a Huckster skill check against the value of an opposing Weapon. If successful, discard both the booted Hex and the Weapon.

title: Pete Spence
text: Noon Job, Boot: Mark an in-town location Pete is not at. If successful, choose an Attire or non-Unique Weapon in your discard pile and attach it to one of your dudes, booted (paying all costs). If that dude attached a Weapon and has no bounty, raise their bounty by 1.

title: Jonah Essex (Exp.1)
text: If your outfit is , Jonah's cost is reduced by the number of different Hexes you control. Other wanted dudes in Jonah's posse have +1 bullets. Noon/Shootout: Discard an opponent's attached card at this location with cost equal to or less than Jonah's bounty. Raise the bounty of your dude at this location by 1.

title: Camillus S. Fly
text: React: After Camillus enters play during High Noon, one of your other dudes becomes a stud.
flavor: "After that day I could use some quiet. Be happy to help you develop those plates, Ms. Loomis"

title: QUATERMAN PRIME
text:
QUATERMAN PRIME must be invented, and enters play at the Mad Scientist's location.

QUATERMAN PRIME'S bullets cannot be modified except by his attached goods. Cards cannot boot or move QUATERMAN PRIME. 

Each time a player reveals a cheatin' hand in QUATERMAN PRIME'S shootout, that player takes an additional casualty.

title: Winona Rein-Breaker
text: Shootout, Pay 1 Ghost Rock, Boot: Discard an opposing Sidekick.
flavor: "I saw that sickly outlaw ride his pale horse into the Badlands, followed by his posse. The creatures there are in danger."

title: Nicole Sumner
text: While Nicole is wanted, she has +3 bullets. When Nicole is wanted, her influence is reduced to 0. React: After you win lowball, reduce Nicole's bounty to 0.
flavor: The one with the heart... and the Sumner temper to match.

title: Red River Roulette
text: Resolution, Boot: If your hand is legal, boot your dude at this deed to prevent all casualties this round. Dudes cannot flee this round. In the next round of the shootout, double the number of casualties inflicted.

title: Kiva of Fathomless Reach
text: React, Boot: After victory is checkec during Sundown, move your dude to town square.
flavor: "The Hopi of this area are unsure how far its depths extend, and believe a kachina may have built it." -Tawodi

title: Crystal Palace
text: Abomination dudes at this location have +1 bullets and +1 influence.
flavor: "The veil between worlds is weak there. You may encounter spirits much fouler than tequila." -Valeria Batten

title: Rham's Readings
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Reveal the top card of an opponent's deck. If that has the same value or suit as the top card in their discard pile, gain 1 ghost rock. If a joker is revealed, ace it and reveal the next card.

title: Jonah's Retreat
text: The player who controls Jonah's Retreat collects its production.
flavor: "This will suit the Alliance's needs nicely, and give me a safe perch to recuperate if this affliction gives me trouble." -Jonah Essex

title: Schieffelin Hall
text: When forming draw hands during shootouts at this location, all dudes use their influence instead of bullets to determine how many cards each player draws <i>(but keep their bullet type)<i>.

title: Blue Lightnin'
text: This dude is a stud. Repeat Shootout: Boot this dude's Hex. This dude gets +1 bullets or +1 Huckster skill.
flavor: "In the end, not even Zeb's blue lightnin' could save him from an untimely death." -Papa Marias

title: Magnum Rounds
text: Shootout: This dude gets +1 bullets. If you reveal a legal draw hand this round, hand ranks can only be modified by traits and Cheatin' Resolutions. Discard this card.
flavor: "Eat lead, ya varmint!"

title: Iron Mole
text: If Iron Mole is at an Out of Town deed, increase that deed's production by 1. Noon, Boot: Move this dude to an Out of Town deed. Shootout, Boot: If this dude is at an Out of Town deed, this dude joins your posse (moving if necessary).

title: Net Gun
text: Shootout, Boot: This dude makes a Mad Scientist skill check against an opposing dude's value. If successful, discard this card and and make that dude a draw.
flavor: A new way to tangle with the law.

title: Scratch
text: If Scratch is discarded from play, discard a card to draw a card. Noon/Shootout, Boot: Move Scratch to another of your dudes at an adjacent location.
flavor: Still has 9 lives, unlike her owners.

title: Battered Banjo
text: React, Boot: After a Hymn is successfully cast at this location, this dude gains +1 influence. Noon, Boot: Discard this card to give an opposing dude at this location -2 bullets.

title: Bolts o' Doom
text: Shootout Hex 7, Boot: Reduce an opposing dude's bullets by this dude's influence. If that dude has 0 bullets, this dude gets +1 bullets.
flavor: "I'm sorry, you were expecting a gunfight?" -Nicodemus Whateley

title: Lethargy
text: Noon Hex X, Boot: X is the grit of an unbooted dude at this or an adjacent location. At sundown, that dude does not unboot unless their controller pays 1 ghost rock.
flavor: "Maybe vengeance can wait a day..."

title: Mind Twist
text: Noon/Shootout Hex 6, Boot: Boot a spell attached to a dude at this location. If this is a shootout, the spell must be in the opposing posse. Noon Hex 6, Boot: Choose a dude at this location. Until after Sundown, that dude's influence is set to 1 (and cannot be modified).

title: Dies Irae
text: Shootout Miracle 8, Boot: After choosing your shooter this round, up to four dudes in your Boot Hill contribute bullets to your draw and stud bonus (as back-up dudes). Your dudes cannot flee the shootout this round.

title: Babble On
text: React Miracle 6: After another Miracle boots your dude, unboot that dude. Shootout Miracle 7, Boot: Boot this dude to boot an opposing card.

title: Ancestor's Reproach
text: Shootout Spirit 8, Boot: Ace a card from your hand. An Ancestor Spirit enters play at this location and joins your posse. Cheatin' Resolution Spirit 6, Boot: An Ancestor Spirit enters play at this location and joins your posse.

title: Secret Paths
text: Noon Spirit 8, Boot: Move all of your unbooted dudes at this location to another location.
flavor: "Black Elk guided us through the Hunting Grounds, bringing us straight to the kiva's depths." -Geronimo

title: Fannin' the Hammer
text: Shootout: Boot your dude to choose a number of opposing dudes equal to your dude's bullet rating. Each chosen dude with 0 printed bullets becomes a draw. Each chosen dude gets -1 bullets.
flavor: "Doc, I swear that was more than six shots..." -Virgil Earp

title: Tumblebleeds!
text: During shootouts at this location, the losing posse takes an additional casualty. Each player gains the ability: "Noon Job: Mark the town square. If successful, discard a number of attached Tumblebleeds! equal to the number of dudes in your posse." Noon: Boot your Huckster to attach this card to town square.

title: Takin' Cover
text: Shootout: Give one of your dudes -1 bullets. That dude cannot be chosen as a casualty this round unless you lose this shootout round by 3 or more ranks.
flavor: "There's no escape, Clanton! We're takin' the ranch now. Throw up your sashes!" -Wyatt Earp

title: Hell's Comin' With Me!
text: Shootout: One of your dudes joins your posse (moving if necessary). If that dude has a Sidekick, you may make another shootout play with one of that dude's attached cards.
flavor: "A violent ending was unavoidable. I'll let Gomorra know of their passing." -Sgt. Elijah Clay

title: Frontier Feud
text: Noon: Move your unbooted in-town dude to town square and boot them. Your opponent must either give that dude 1 permanent control point, or move one of their in-town dudes to town square and call out that dude. No other dudes may join this shootout.

title: Seizing the Pearl of Death
text: Cheatin' Resolution Technique: Draw a card. You may send a dude at this location home booted. If this is a shootout, reduce your casualties by 1 and increase your opponent's casualties by 1. If your hand is legal, this dude gets +1 bullets and +1 influence until Sundown.

title: Bai Yang Chen (Exp.1)
text: Bai Yang Chen cannot have attachments. While Bai Yang Chen is in a posse, after each shootout play (including passing), remove any modifiers to his bullet rating, set it to 5, and then reduce it by 1 for each card in your hand. Noon: If you have no ghost rock in your stash, draw a card.

title: Arthur Dingler
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, look at the top 5 cards of your deck. You may discard them, shuffle them into your deck, or return them to your deck in the same order. Take 1 ghost rock from the bank and add it to the pot for the Gamblin' phase.

title: Victor "Nines" de Boré
text: Victor has a bonus to his Huckster skill equal to the number of Abominations at his location. This bonus cannot exceed +4.
flavor: "That Hoyle's was priceless! We need to get it back now, by any means necessary!"

title: Seth Bullock
text: While your draw hand is cheatin', Seth lowers your hand rank by his bullet rating if he is in your posse. React: After you use a Cheatin' Resolution ability on an action card, unboot Seth.

title: Rosaleen Byrne
text: React, Boot: At the start of the game, discard 2 cards from your hand to draw 2 cards.
flavor: "Oh, darlin', it's not what can I do for you, it's what can you do for me."

title: Reggie Mallard
text: Reggie has a bullet bonus equal to the number of Hucksters in his posse. This bonus cannot exceed +4.
flavor: "Head straight into town and flush out the law. I've got your back."

title: Land Purchase
text: Controller Noon Job, Boot: Mark this deed. If successful, discard this deed to choose a deed in your discard pile and play it, reducing its cost by 3.
flavor: Please see Mr. Bearclaw re permits.

title: Heath's Curiosity Shoppe
text: Controller Noon, Boot: Discard 2 cards. Choose a non-Unique card in your discard pile that matches the suit of one of the discarded cards and the value of the other discarded card, and put it into your hand.

title: Baird's Debt Collections
text: Each time a deed is played, gain 1 ghost rock. Controller Noon, Boot: Discard a card from your hand to boot a deed.
flavor: "Time to settle, Mr. Healey. Fetch what I need from Arizona." -Mr. Baird

title: Feathered Friend
text: Noon, Boot: Choose a dude at this location. Look at a random card in their controller's hand. Shootout, Boot: Look at a random card in your opponent's hand.
